Cataclysm BN
Classes | Public Types | Public Member Functions | Static Public Member Functions | List of all members
item Class Reference

Melee

The functions here assume the item is used in melee, even if's a gun or not a weapon at all.

Because the functions apply to all types of items, several of the is_* functions here may return true for the same item. This only indicates that it can be used in various ways.

int attack_cost () const
 Base number of moves (Creature::moves) that a single melee attack with this items takes. More...
 
int damage_melee (damage_type dt) const
 Damage of given type caused when this item is used as melee weapon. More...

 All damage types this item deals when used in melee (no skill modifiers etc. More...

 All damage types this item deals when thrown (no skill modifiers etc. More...

Containers

Containers come in two flavors:

  • suitable for liquids (is_watertight_container),
  • and the remaining one (they are for currently only for flavor).

 Whether this is container. More...

bool will_explode_in_fire () const
 
Material(s) of the item

Each item is made of one or more materials (material_type).

Materials have properties that affect properties of the item (e.g. resistance against certain damage types).

Corpses inherit the material of the monster type.

const material_type & get_random_material () const
 Get a material reference to a random material that this item is made of. More...
 
const material_type & get_base_material () const
 Get the basic (main) material of this item. More...

 Number of (charges of) this item that fit into the given volume. More...
 
Item variables

Item variables can be used to store any value in the item.

The storage is persistent, it remains through saving & loading, it is copied when the item is moved etc. Each item variable is referred to by its name, so make sure you use a name that is not already used somewhere. You can directly store integer, floating point and string values. Data of other types must be converted to one of those to be stored. The set_var functions override the existing value. The get_var function return the value (if the variable exists), or the default value otherwise. The type of the default value determines which get_var function is used. All numeric values are returned as doubles and may be cast to the desired type. int v = itm.get_var("v", 0); // v will be an int double d = itm.get_var("v", 0.0); // d will be a double std::string s = itm.get_var("v", ""); // s will be a std::string // no default means empty string as default: auto n = itm.get_var("v"); // v will be a std::string

void set_var (const std::string &name, int value)
 
void set_var (const std::string &name, long long value)
 
void set_var (const std::string &name, long value)
 
void set_var (const std::string &name, double value)
 
double get_var (const std::string &name, double default_value) const
 
void set_var (const std::string &name, const tripoint &value)
 
tripoint get_var (const std::string &name, const tripoint &default_value) const
 
void set_var (const std::string &name, const std::string &value)
 
std::string get_var (const std::string &name, const std::string &default_value) const
 
std::string get_var (const std::string &name) const
 Get the variable, if it does not exists, returns an empty string. More...
 
bool has_var (const std::string &name) const
 Whether the variable is defined at all. More...
 
void erase_var (const std::string &name)
 Erase the value of the given variable. More...
 
void clear_vars ()
 Removes all item variables. More...
 
Item flags

If you use any new flags, add them to flags.json, add a comment to doc/JSON_FLAGS.md and make sure your new flag does not conflict with any existing flag.

Item flags are taken from the item type (itype::item_tags), but also from the item itself (item_tags). The item has the flag if it appears in either set.

Gun mods that are attached to guns also contribute their flags to the gun item.

bool has_flag (const std::string &flag) const
 
bool has_flag (const flag_str_id &flag) const
 
template<typename Container , typename T = std::decay_t<decltype( *std::declval<const Container &>().begin() )>>
bool has_any_flag (const Container &flags) const
 
bool has_own_flag (const std::string &flag) const
 Checks whether item itself has given flag (doesn't check item type or gunmods). More...
 
const FlagsSetType & get_flags () const
 returs read-only set of flags of this item (not including flags from item type or gunmods) More...
 
item & set_flag (const std::string &flag)
 Idempotent filter setting an item specific flag. More...
 
item & unset_flag (const std::string &flag)
 Idempotent filter removing an item specific flag. More...
 
item & set_flag_recursive (const std::string &flag)
 Idempotent filter recursively setting an item specific flag on this item and its components. More...
 
void unset_flags ()
 Removes all item specific flags. More...
 
bool has_fault (const fault_id &fault) const
 Does this item have the specified fault. More...
 
Item properties

Properties are specific to an item type so unlike flags the meaning of a property may not be the same for two different item types.

Each item type can have multiple properties however duplicate property names are not permitted.

bool has_property (const std::string &prop) const
 
std::string get_property_string (const std::string &prop, const std::string &def="") const
 Get typed property for item. More...
 
int64_t get_property_int64_t (const std::string &prop, int64_t def=0) const

Items can emit light either through the definition of their type (itype::light_emission) or through an item specific light data (light).

using item::archive_type_tag = io::object_archive_tag

Member Function Documentation

◆ acid_resist()

int item::acid_resist ( bool  to_self = false,
int  base_env_resist = 0 
) const

Resistance against different damage types (damage_type).

Larger values means more resistance are thereby better, but there is no absolute value to compare them to. The values can be interpreted as chance (one_in) of damaging the item when exposed to the type of damage.

Parameters
to_selfIf this is true, it returns item's own resistance, not one it gives to wearer.
base_env_resistWill override the base environmental resistance (to allow hypothetical calculations for gas masks).

Definition at line 6120 of file item.cpp.

6121{
6122 if( to_self ) {
6123 // Currently no items are damaged by acid
6124 return INT_MAX;
6125 }
6126
6127 float resist = 0.0;
6128 float mod = get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_acid );
6129 if( is_null() ) {
6130 return 0.0;
6131 }
6132
6133 const std::vector<const material_type *> mat_types = made_of_types();
6134 if( !mat_types.empty() ) {
6135 // Not sure why cut and bash get an armor thickness bonus but acid doesn't,
6136 // but such is the way of the code.
6137
6138 for( const material_type *mat : mat_types ) {
6139 resist += mat->acid_resist();
6140 }
6141 // Average based on number of materials.
6142 resist /= mat_types.size();
6143 }
6144
6145 const int env = get_env_resist( base_env_resist );
6146 if( env < 10 ) {
6147 // Low env protection means it doesn't prevent acid seeping in.
6148 resist *= env / 10.0f;
6149 }
6150
6151 return std::lround( resist + mod );
6152}

◆ actualize_rot()

bool item::actualize_rot ( const tripoint &  pnt,
temperature_flag  temperature,
const weather_manager &  weather 
)

Whether the item has to be removed as it has rotten away completely.

May change the item as it calls process_rot()

Parameters
pntThe position of the item on the current map.
temperatureFlag for special locations that affect temperature.
weatherWeather manager to supply temperature.
Returns
true if the item has rotten away and should be removed, false otherwise.

Definition at line 8792 of file item.cpp.

8794{
8795 if( goes_bad() ) {
8796 return process_rot( false, pnt, nullptr, temperature, weather );
8797 } else if( type->container && type->container->preserves ) {
8798 // Containers like tin cans preserves all items inside, they do not rot at all.
8799 return false;
8800 } else if( type->container && type->container->seals ) {
8801 // Items inside rot but do not vanish as the container seals them in.
8802 for( item *c : contents.all_items_top() ) {
8803 if( c->goes_bad() ) {
8804 c->process_rot( true, pnt, nullptr, temperature, weather );
8805 }
8806 }
8807 return false;
8808 } else {
8809 std::vector<item *> removed_items;
8810 // Check and remove rotten contents, but always keep the container.
8811 for( item *it : contents.all_items_top() ) {
8812 if( it->actualize_rot( pnt, temperature, weather ) ) {
8813 removed_items.push_back( it );
8814 }
8815 }
8816 for( item *it : removed_items ) {
8817 remove_item( *it );
8818 }
8819
8820 return false;
8821 }
8822}

◆ ammo_consume()

int item::ammo_consume ( int  qty,
const tripoint &  pos 
)

Consume ammo (if available) and return the amount of ammo that was consumed.

Parameters
qtymaximum amount of ammo that should be consumed
poscurrent location of item, used for ejecting magazines and similar effects
Returns
amount of ammo consumed which will be between 0 and qty

Definition at line 7473 of file item.cpp.

7474{
7475 if( qty < 0 ) {
7476 debugmsg( "Cannot consume negative quantity of ammo for %s", tname() );
7477 return 0;
7478 }
7479
7480 item *mag = magazine_current();
7481 if( mag ) {
7482 const int res = mag->ammo_consume( qty, pos );
7483 if( res && ammo_remaining() == 0 ) {
7484 if( mag->has_flag( flag_MAG_DESTROY ) ) {
7485 remove_item( *mag );
7486 } else if( mag->has_flag( flag_MAG_EJECT ) ) {
7487 get_map().add_item( pos, *mag );
7488 remove_item( *mag );
7489 }
7490 }
7491 return res;
7492 }
7493
7494 if( is_magazine() ) {
7495 int need = qty;
7496 while( !contents.empty() ) {
7497 item &e = contents.front();
7498 if( need >= e.charges ) {
7499 need -= e.charges;
7500 remove_item( contents.front() );
7501 } else {
7502 e.charges -= need;
7503 need = 0;
7504 break;
7505 }
7506 }
7507 return qty - need;
7508
7509 } else if( is_tool() || is_gun() ) {
7510 qty = std::min( qty, charges );
7511 if( has_flag( flag_USES_BIONIC_POWER ) ) {
7512 avatar &you = get_avatar();
7513 charges = units::to_kilojoule( you.get_power_level() );
7514 you.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( -qty ) );
7515 }
7516 charges -= qty;
7517 if( charges == 0 ) {
7518 curammo = nullptr;
7519 }
7520 return qty;
7521 }
7522
7523 return 0;
7524}

◆ ammo_set()

item & item::ammo_set ( const itype_id &  ammo,
int  qty = -1 
)

Filter setting the ammo for this instance Any existing ammo is removed.

If necessary a magazine is also added.

Parameters
ammospecific type of ammo (must be compatible with item ammo type)
qtymaximum ammo (capped by item capacity) or negative to fill to capacity
Returns
same instance to allow method chaining

Definition at line 591 of file item.cpp.

592{
593 if( qty < 0 ) {
594 // completely fill an integral or existing magazine
595 if( magazine_integral() || magazine_current() ) {
596 qty = ammo_capacity();
597
598 // else try to add a magazine using default ammo count property if set
599 } else if( !magazine_default().is_null() ) {
600 item mag( magazine_default() );
601 if( mag.type->magazine->count > 0 ) {
602 qty = mag.type->magazine->count;
603 } else {
604 qty = item( magazine_default() ).ammo_capacity();
605 }
606 }
607 }
608
609 if( qty <= 0 ) {
610 ammo_unset();
611 return *this;
612 }
613
614 // handle reloadable tools and guns with no specific ammo type as special case
615 if( ( ammo.is_null() && ammo_types().empty() ) || is_money() ) {
616 if( ( is_tool() || is_gun() ) && magazine_integral() ) {
617 curammo = nullptr;
618 charges = std::min( qty, ammo_capacity() );
619 }
620 return *this;
621 }
622
623 // check ammo is valid for the item
624 const itype *atype = &*ammo;
625 if( !atype->ammo || !ammo_types().count( atype->ammo->type ) ) {
626 debugmsg( "Tried to set invalid ammo %s[%d] for %s", atype->get_id(), qty, typeId() );
627 return *this;
628 }
629
630 if( is_magazine() ) {
631 ammo_unset();
632 item set_ammo( ammo, calendar::turn, std::min( qty, ammo_capacity() ) );
633 if( has_flag( flag_NO_UNLOAD ) ) {
634 set_ammo.set_flag( "NO_DROP" );
635 set_ammo.set_flag( "IRREMOVABLE" );
636 }
637 put_in( set_ammo );
638
639 } else if( magazine_integral() ) {
640 curammo = atype;
641 charges = std::min( qty, ammo_capacity() );
642
643 } else {
644 if( !magazine_current() ) {
645 itype_id mag = magazine_default();
646 if( !mag->magazine ) {
647 debugmsg( "Tried to set ammo %s[%d] without suitable magazine for %s",
648 atype->get_id(), qty, typeId() );
649 return *this;
650 }
651
652 // if default magazine too small fetch instead closest available match
653 if( mag->magazine->capacity < qty ) {
654 // as above call to magazine_default successful can infer minimum one option exists
655 auto iter = type->magazines.find( atype->ammo->type );
656 if( iter == type->magazines.end() ) {
657 debugmsg( "%s doesn't have a magazine for %s",
658 typeId(), ammo );
659 return *this;
660 }
661 std::vector<itype_id> opts( iter->second.begin(), iter->second.end() );
662 std::sort( opts.begin(), opts.end(), []( const itype_id & lhs, const itype_id & rhs ) {
663 return lhs->magazine->capacity < rhs->magazine->capacity;
664 } );
665 mag = opts.back();
666 for( const itype_id &e : opts ) {
667 if( e->magazine->capacity >= qty ) {
668 mag = e;
669 break;
670 }
671 }
672 }
673 put_in( item( mag ) );
674 }
675 magazine_current()->ammo_set( ammo, qty );
676 }
677
678 return *this;
679}

◆ ammo_sufficient()

bool item::ammo_sufficient ( int  qty = 1) const

Check if sufficient ammo is loaded for given number of uses.

Check if there is enough ammo loaded in a tool for the given number of uses or given number of gun shots. Using this function for this check is preferred because we expect to add support for items consuming multiple ammo types in the future. Users of this function will not need to be refactored when this happens.

Parameters
[in]qtyNumber of uses
Returns
true if ammo sufficient for number of uses is loaded, false otherwise

Definition at line 7468 of file item.cpp.

2747 _( "* This item can be <info>worn with a "

2749 }

2752 switch( sizing_level ) {
2753 case sizing::human_sized_human_char:
2754 if( has_flag( flag_FIT ) ) {
2755 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
2756 _( "* This clothing <info>fits</info> you perfectly." ) );
2757 }
2758 break;
2759 case sizing::big_sized_big_char:

2761 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", _( "* This clothing <info>fits</info> "
2762 "your large frame perfectly." ) );
2763 }
2764 break;
2765 case sizing::small_sized_small_char:
2766 if( has_flag( flag_FIT ) ) {
2767 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", _( "* This clothing <info>fits</info> "
2768 "your small frame perfectly." ) );
2769 }
2770 break;
2771 case sizing::big_sized_human_char:
2772 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", _( "* This clothing is <bad>oversized</bad> "
2773 "and does <bad>not fit</bad> you." ) );
2774 break;
2775 case sizing::big_sized_small_char:
2776 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
2777 _( "* This clothing is hilariously <bad>oversized</bad> "
2778 "and does <bad>not fit</bad> your <info>abnormally "
2779 "small mutated anatomy</info>." ) );
2780 break;
2781 case sizing::human_sized_big_char:
2782 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
2783 _( "* This clothing is <bad>normal sized</bad> and does "
2784 "<bad>not fit</info> your <info>abnormally large "
2785 "mutated anatomy</info>." ) );
2786 break;
2787 case sizing::human_sized_small_char:
2788 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
2789 _( "* This clothing is <bad>normal sized</bad> and does "
2790 "<bad>not fit</bad> your <info>abnormally small "
2791 "mutated anatomy</info>." ) );
2792 break;
2793 case sizing::small_sized_big_char:
2794 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
2795 _( "* This clothing is hilariously <bad>undersized</bad> "
2796 "and does <bad>not fit</bad> your <info>abnormally "
2797 "large mutated anatomy</info>." ) );
2798 break;
2799 case sizing::small_sized_human_char:
2800 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", _( "* This clothing is <bad>undersized</bad> "
2801 "and does <bad>not fit</bad> you." ) );
2802 break;
2803 default:
2804 break;
2805 }
2806 }
2807
2808 if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_FLAGS_VARSIZE ) ) {
2809 if( has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) ) {
2810 std::string resize_str;
2811 if( has_flag( flag_FIT ) ) {
2812 switch( sizing_level ) {
2813 case sizing::small_sized_human_char:
2814 resize_str = _( "<info>can be upsized</info>" );
2815 break;
2816 case sizing::human_sized_small_char:
2817 resize_str = _( "<info>can be downsized</info>" );
2818 break;
2819 case sizing::big_sized_human_char:
2820 case sizing::big_sized_small_char:
2821 resize_str = _( "<bad>can not be downsized</bad>" );
2822 break;
2823 case sizing::small_sized_big_char:
2824 case sizing::human_sized_big_char:
2825 resize_str = _( "<bad>can not be upsized</bad>" );
2826 break;
2827 default:
2828 break;
2829 }
2830 if( !resize_str.empty() ) {
2831 std::string info_str = string_format( _( "* This clothing %s." ), resize_str );
2832 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION", info_str ) );
2833 }
2834 } else {
2835 switch( sizing_level ) {
2836 case sizing::small_sized_human_char:
2837 resize_str = _( " and <info>upsized</info>" );
2838 break;
2839 case sizing::human_sized_small_char:
2840 resize_str = _( " and <info>downsized</info>" );
2841 break;
2842 case sizing::big_sized_human_char:
2843 case sizing::big_sized_small_char:
2844 resize_str = _( " but <bad>not downsized</bad>" );
2845 break;
2846 case sizing::small_sized_big_char:
2847 case sizing::human_sized_big_char:
2848 resize_str = _( " but <bad>not upsized</bad>" );
2849 break;
2850 default:
2851 break;
2852 }
2853 std::string info_str = string_format( _( "* This clothing <info>can be "
2854 "refitted</info>%s." ), resize_str );
2855 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION", info_str ) );
2856 }
2857 } else {
2858 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", _( "* This clothing <bad>can not be refitted, "
2859 "upsized, or downsized</bad>." ) );
2860 }
2861 }

2865 _( "* This item can be worn on <info>either side</info> of "
2866 "the body." ) ) );
2867 }

2869 parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_FLAGS_POWERARMOR ) ) {

2872 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
2873 _( "* When worn with a power armor suit, it will "
2874 "<good>fully protect</good> you from "
2875 "<info>radiation</info>." ) ) );

2878 _( "* When worn with a power armor helmet, it will "
2879 "<good>fully protect</good> you from " "<info>radiation</info>." ) ) );
2880 }
2881 }
2882 }

2884 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
2885 string_format( _( "* The film strip on the badge is %s." ),
2886 rad_badge_color( irradiation ) ) ) );
2887 }

◆ attack_cost()

int item::attack_cost ( ) const

Base number of moves (Creature::moves) that a single melee attack with this items takes.

The actual time depends heavily on the attacker, see melee.cpp.

◆ base_damage_melee()

damage_instance item::base_damage_melee ( ) const

◆ base_volume()

units::volume item::base_volume ( ) const

Simplified, faster volume check for when processing time is important and exact volume is not.

NOTE: Result is rounded up to next nearest milliliter when working with stackable (count_by_charges) items that have fractional volume per charge. If trying to determine how many of an item can fit in a given space, charges_per_volume should be used instead.

Definition at line 5069 of file item.cpp.

5070{
5071 if( is_null() ) {
5072 return 0_ml;
5073 }
5074 if( is_corpse() ) {
5075 return corpse_volume( corpse );
5076 }
5077
5078 if( is_craft() ) {
5079 units::volume ret = 0_ml;
5080 for( const item &it : components ) {
5081 ret += it.base_volume();
5082 }
5083 return ret;
5084 }
5085
5086 if( count_by_charges() ) {
5087 if( type->volume % type->stack_size == 0_ml ) {
5088 return type->volume / type->stack_size;
5089 } else {
5090 return type->volume / type->stack_size + 1_ml;
5091 }
5092 }
5093
5094 return type->volume;
5095}

◆ bash_resist()

int item::bash_resist ( bool  to_self = false) const

Definition at line 6024 of file item.cpp.

6025{
6026 if( is_null() ) {
6027 return 0;
6028 }
6029
6030 float resist = 0;
6031 float mod = get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_bash );
6032 int eff_thickness = 1;
6033
6034 // base resistance
6035 // Don't give reinforced items +armor, just more resistance to ripping
6036 const int dmg = damage_level( 4 );
6037 const int eff_damage = to_self ? std::min( dmg, 0 ) : std::max( dmg, 0 );
6038 eff_thickness = std::max( 1, get_thickness() - eff_damage );
6039
6040 const std::vector<const material_type *> mat_types = made_of_types();
6041 if( !mat_types.empty() ) {
6042 for( const material_type *mat : mat_types ) {
6043 resist += mat->bash_resist();
6044 }
6045 // Average based on number of materials.
6046 resist /= mat_types.size();
6047 }
6048
6049 return std::lround( ( resist * eff_thickness ) + mod );
6050}
item::get_thickness
int get_thickness() const
Returns the islot_armor::thickness value, or 0 for non-armor.

3326 if( !bid->bash_protec.empty() ) {
3327 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3328 _( "<bold>Bash Protection</bold>: " ),
3329 iteminfo::no_newline ) );
3330 for( const std::pair< const bodypart_str_id, int > element : sorted_lex( bid->bash_protec ) ) {
3331 info.push_back( iteminfo( "CBM", body_part_name_as_heading( element.first->token, 1 ),
3332 " <num> ", iteminfo::no_newline, element.second ) );
3333 }
3334 }
3335

3337 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3338 _( "<bold>Cut Protection</bold>: " ),
3339 iteminfo::no_newline ) );

3355 if( !bid->stat_bonus.empty() ) {

3357 iteminfo::no_newline ) );

3360 iteminfo::no_newline, element.second ) );
3361 }
3362 }
3363
3364 const units::mass weight_bonus = bid->weight_capacity_bonus;
3365 const float weight_modif = bid->weight_capacity_modifier;
3366 if( weight_modif != 1 ) {
3367 std::string modifier;
3368 if( weight_modif < 1 ) {
3369 modifier = "<num><bad>x</bad>";
3370 } else {
3371 modifier = "<num><color_light_green>x</color>";
3372 }
3373 info.push_back( iteminfo( "CBM",
3374 _( "<bold>Weight capacity modifier</bold>: " ), modifier,
3375 iteminfo::no_newline | iteminfo::is_decimal,
3376 weight_modif ) );
3377 }
3378 if( weight_bonus != 0_gram ) {
3379 std::string bonus;
3380 if( weight_bonus < 0_gram ) {
3381 bonus = string_format( "<num> <bad>%s</bad>", weight_units() );
3382 } else {
3383 bonus = string_format( "<num> <color_light_green>%s</color>", weight_units() );
3384 }
3385 info.push_back( iteminfo( "CBM", _( "<bold>Weight capacity bonus</bold>: " ), bonus,
3386 iteminfo::no_newline | iteminfo::is_decimal,
3387 convert_weight( weight_bonus ) ) );
3388 }

◆ bullet_resist()

int item::bullet_resist ( bool  to_self = false) const

Definition at line 6091 of file item.cpp.

6092{
6093 if( is_null() ) {
6094 return 0;
6095 }
6096
6097 const int base_thickness = get_thickness();
6098 float resist = 0;
6099 float mod = get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_bullet );
6100 int eff_thickness = 1;
6101
6102 // base resistance
6103 // Don't give reinforced items +armor, just more resistance to ripping
6104 const int dmg = damage_level( 4 );
6105 const int eff_damage = to_self ? std::min( dmg, 0 ) : std::max( dmg, 0 );
6106 eff_thickness = std::max( 1, base_thickness - eff_damage );
6107
6108 const std::vector<const material_type *> mat_types = made_of_types();
6109 if( !mat_types.empty() ) {
6110 for( const material_type *mat : mat_types ) {
6111 resist += mat->bullet_resist();
6112 }
6113 // Average based on number of materials.
6114 resist /= mat_types.size();
6115 }
6116
6117 return std::lround( ( resist * eff_thickness ) + mod );
6118}
clothing_mod_type_bullet
@ clothing_mod_type_bullet
Definition: clothing_mod.h:21

References clothing_mod_type_bullet, damage_level(), get_clothing_mod_val(), get_thickness(), is_null(), and made_of_types().

8274 float burn_added = simulate_burn( frd );
8275
8276 if( burn_added <= 0 ) {
8277 return false;
8278 }
8279
8280 if( count_by_charges() ) {
8281 if( type->volume == 0_ml ) {
8282 charges = 0;
8283 } else {
8284 charges -= roll_remainder( burn_added * units::legacy_volume_factor * type->stack_size /
8285 ( 3.0 * type->volume ) );
8286 }
8287
8288 return charges <= 0;
8289 }
8290
8291 if( is_corpse() ) {
8292 const mtype *mt = get_mtype();
8293 if( active && mt != nullptr && burnt + burn_added > mt->hp &&
8294 !mt->burn_into.is_null() && mt->burn_into.is_valid() ) {
8295 corpse = &get_mtype()->burn_into.obj();
8296 // Delay rezing
8297 set_age( 0_turns );
8298 burnt = 0;
8299 return false;
8300 }
8301 }
8302
8303 burnt += roll_remainder( burn_added );
8304
8305 const int vol = base_volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor;
8306 return burnt >= vol * 3;
8307}
item::base_volume
units::volume base_volume() const
Simplified, faster volume check for when processing time is important and exact volume is not.
Definition: item.cpp:5069
item::simulate_burn
float simulate_burn(fire_data &frd) const
Calculate all burning calculations, but don't actually apply them to item.
Definition: item.cpp:8219

const mtype * get_mtype() const
Definition: item.cpp:6618

Definition: item.cpp:9998

◆ calc_rot()

time_duration item::calc_rot ( time_point  time,
int  temp 
) const

Returns rot of the item since last rot calculation.

This function should not be called directly. since it does not have all the needed checks or temperature calculations. If you need to calc rot of item call process_rot instead.

Parameters
timeTime point to which rot is calculated
tempTemperature at which the rot is calculated

Definition at line 5644 of file item.cpp.

5645{
5646 // Avoid needlessly calculating already rotten things. Corpses should
5647 // always rot away and food rots away at twice the shelf life. If the food
5648 // is in a sealed container they won't rot away, this avoids needlessly
5649 // calculating their rot in that case.
5650 if( !is_corpse() && get_relative_rot() > 2.0 ) {
5651 return time_duration::from_seconds( 0 );
5652 }
5653
5654 // rot modifier
5655 float factor = 1.0;
5656 if( is_corpse() && has_flag( flag_FIELD_DRESS ) ) {
5657 factor = 0.75;
5658 }
5659
5660 time_duration added_rot = time_duration::from_seconds( 0 );
5661 // simulation of different age of food at the start of the game and good/bad storage
5662 // conditions by applying starting variation bonus/penalty of +/- 20% of base shelf-life
5663 // positive = food was produced some time before calendar::start and/or bad storage
5664 // negative = food was stored in good conditions before calendar::start
5665 if( last_rot_check <= calendar::start_of_cataclysm ) {
5666 time_duration spoil_variation = get_shelf_life() * 0.2f;
5667 added_rot += rng( -spoil_variation, spoil_variation );
5668 }
5669
5670 time_duration time_delta = time - last_rot_check;
5671 added_rot += factor * time_delta / 1_hours * get_hourly_rotpoints_at_temp( temp ) * 1_turns;
5672 return added_rot;
5673}
time_duration
A duration defined as a number of specific time units.
Definition: calendar.h:180
time_duration::from_seconds
static constexpr time_duration from_seconds(const T t)
Definition: calendar.h:208
flag_FIELD_DRESS
static const std::string flag_FIELD_DRESS("FIELD_DRESS")
get_hourly_rotpoints_at_temp
int get_hourly_rotpoints_at_temp(const int temp)
Get the hourly rot for a given temperature from the precomputed table.
Definition: item.cpp:5628

@ time

◆ charges_per_volume()

int item::charges_per_volume ( const units::volume &  vol) const

Number of (charges of) this item that fit into the given volume.

May return 0 if not even one charge fits into the volume. Only depends on the type of this item not on its current charge count.

For items not counted by charges, this returns vol / this->volume().

Definition at line 865 of file item.cpp.

866{
867 if( count_by_charges() ) {
868 if( type->volume == 0_ml ) {
869 debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname() );
870 return INFINITE_CHARGES;
871 }
872 // Type cast to prevent integer overflow with large volume containers like the cargo
873 // dimension
874 return vol * static_cast<int64_t>( type->stack_size ) / type->volume;
875 } else {
876 units::volume my_volume = volume();
877 if( my_volume == 0_ml ) {
878 debugmsg( "Item '%s' with zero volume", tname() );
879 return INFINITE_CHARGES;
880 }
881 return vol / my_volume;
882 }
883}

6190 res = worst ? std::min( res, val ) : std::max( res, val );

6192

◆ color_in_inventory() [2/2]

nc_color item::color_in_inventory ( const player &  p) const

Returns the color of the item depending on usefulness for the passed player, e.g.

differently if it its an unread book or a spoiling food item etc. This should only be used for displaying data, it should not affect game play.

Parameters
for_playerNPC or avatar which would read book.

Definition at line 4125 of file item.cpp.

4126{
4127 // Only item not otherwise colored gets colored as favorite
4128 nc_color ret = is_favorite ? c_white : c_light_gray;
4129 if( type->can_use( "learn_spell" ) ) {
4130 const use_function *iuse = get_use( "learn_spell" );
4131 const learn_spell_actor *actor_ptr =
4132 static_cast<const learn_spell_actor *>( iuse->get_actor_ptr() );
4133 for( const std::string &spell_id_str : actor_ptr->spells ) {
4134 const spell_id sp_id( spell_id_str );
4135 if( p.magic->knows_spell( sp_id ) && !p.magic->get_spell( sp_id ).is_max_level() ) {
4136 ret = c_yellow;
4137 }
4138 if( !p.magic->knows_spell( sp_id ) && p.magic->can_learn_spell( p, sp_id ) ) {
4139 return c_light_blue;
4140 }
4141 }
4142 } else if( has_flag( flag_WET ) ) {
4143 ret = c_cyan;
4144 } else if( has_flag( flag_LITCIG ) ) {
4145 ret = c_red;
4146 } else if( is_armor() && p.has_trait( trait_WOOLALLERGY ) &&
4147 ( made_of( material_id( "wool" ) ) || has_own_flag( "wooled" ) ) ) {
4148 ret = c_red;
4149 } else if( is_filthy() || has_own_flag( "DIRTY" ) ) {
4150 ret = c_brown;
4151 } else if( is_bionic() ) {
4152 if( !p.has_bionic( type->bionic->id ) ) {
4153 ret = p.bionic_installation_issues( type->bionic->id ).empty() ? c_green : c_red;
4154 } else if( !has_fault( fault_bionic_nonsterile ) ) {
4155 ret = c_dark_gray;
4156 }
4157 } else if( has_flag( flag_LEAK_DAM ) && has_flag( flag_RADIOACTIVE ) && damage() > 0 ) {
4158 ret = c_light_green;
4159 } else if( active && !is_food() && !is_food_container() && !is_corpse() ) {
4160 // Active items show up as yellow
4161 ret = c_yellow;
4162 } else if( is_corpse() && can_revive() ) {
4163 // Only reviving corpses are yellow
4164 ret = c_yellow;
4165 } else if( const item *food = get_food() ) {
4166 const bool preserves = type->container && type->container->preserves;
4167
4168 // Give color priority to allergy (allergy > inedible by freeze or other conditions)
4169 // TODO: refactor u.will_eat to let this section handle coloring priority without duplicating code.
4170 if( p.allergy_type( *food ) != morale_type( "morale_null" ) ) {
4171 return c_red;
4172 }
4173
4174 // Default: permafood, drugs
4175 // Brown: rotten (for non-saprophages) or non-rotten (for saprophages)
4176 // Dark gray: inedible
4177 // Red: morale penalty
4178 // Yellow: will rot soon
4179 // Cyan: will rot eventually
4180 const ret_val<edible_rating> rating = p.will_eat( *food );
4181 // TODO: More colors
4182 switch( rating.value() ) {
4183 case edible_rating::edible:
4184 case edible_rating::too_full:
4185 if( preserves ) {
4186 // Nothing, canned food won't rot
4187 } else if( food->is_going_bad() ) {
4188 ret = c_yellow;
4189 } else if( food->goes_bad() ) {
4190 ret = c_cyan;
4191 }
4192 break;
4193 case edible_rating::inedible:
4194 case edible_rating::inedible_mutation:
4195 ret = c_dark_gray;
4196 break;
4197 case edible_rating::allergy:
4198 case edible_rating::allergy_weak:
4199 case edible_rating::cannibalism:
4200 ret = c_red;
4201 break;
4202 case edible_rating::rotten:
4203 ret = c_brown;
4204 break;
4205 case edible_rating::nausea:
4206 case edible_rating::bloated:
4207 ret = c_pink;
4208 break;
4209 case edible_rating::no_tool:
4210 break;
4211 }
4212 } else if( is_gun() ) {
4213 // Guns are green if you are carrying ammo for them
4214 // ltred if you have ammo but no mags
4215 // Gun with integrated mag counts as both
4216 for( const ammotype &at : ammo_types() ) {
4217 // get_ammo finds uncontained ammo, find_ammo finds ammo in magazines
4218 bool has_ammo = !character_funcs::get_ammo_items( p, at ).empty() ||
4219 !character_funcs::find_ammo_items_or_mags( p, *this, false, -1 ).empty();
4220 bool has_mag = magazine_integral() ||
4221 !character_funcs::find_ammo_items_or_mags( p, *this, true, -1 ).empty();
4222 if( has_ammo && has_mag ) {
4223 ret = c_green;
4224 break;
4225 } else if( has_ammo || has_mag ) {
4226 ret = c_light_red;
4227 break;
4228 }
4229 }
4230 } else if( is_ammo() ) {
4231 // Likewise, ammo is green if you have guns that use it
4232 // ltred if you have the gun but no mags
4233 // Gun with integrated mag counts as both
4234 bool has_gun = p.has_item_with( [this]( const item & i ) {
4235 return i.is_gun() && i.ammo_types().count( ammo_type() );
4236 } );
4237 bool has_mag = p.has_item_with( [this]( const item & i ) {
4238 return ( i.is_gun() && i.magazine_integral() && i.ammo_types().count( ammo_type() ) ) ||
4239 ( i.is_magazine() && i.ammo_types().count( ammo_type() ) );
4240 } );
4241 if( has_gun && has_mag ) {
4242 ret = c_green;
4243 } else if( has_gun || has_mag ) {
4244 ret = c_light_red;
4245 }
4246 } else if( is_magazine() ) {
4247 // Magazines are green if you have guns and ammo for them
4248 // ltred if you have one but not the other
4249 bool has_gun = p.has_item_with( [this]( const item & it ) {
4250 return it.is_gun() && it.magazine_compatible().count( typeId() ) > 0;
4251 } );
4252 bool has_ammo = !character_funcs::find_ammo_items_or_mags( p, *this, false, -1 ).empty();
4253 if( has_gun && has_ammo ) {
4254 ret = c_green;
4255 } else if( has_gun || has_ammo ) {
4256 ret = c_light_red;
4257 }
4258 } else if( is_book() ) {
4259 const islot_book &tmp = *type->book;
4260 // Player doesn't actually interested if NPC has identified book yet.
4261 // So we check identification for human avatar.
4262 if( get_avatar().has_identified( typeId() ) ) {
4263 if( tmp.skill && // Book can improve skill: blue
4264 p.get_skill_level_object( tmp.skill ).can_train() &&
4265 p.get_skill_level( tmp.skill ) >= tmp.req &&
4266 p.get_skill_level( tmp.skill ) < tmp.level ) {
4267 ret = c_light_blue;
4268 } else if( type->can_use( "MA_MANUAL" ) &&
4269 !p.martial_arts_data->has_martialart( martial_art_learned_from( *type ) ) ) {
4270 ret = c_light_blue;
4271 } else if( tmp.skill && // Book can't improve skill right now, but maybe later: pink
4272 p.get_skill_level_object( tmp.skill ).can_train() &&
4273 p.get_skill_level( tmp.skill ) < tmp.level ) {
4274 ret = c_pink;
4275 } else if( !p.studied_all_recipes(
4276 *type ) ) { // Book can't improve skill anymore, but has more recipes: yellow
4277 ret = c_yellow;
4278 }
4279 } else if( tmp.skill || type->can_use( "MA_MANUAL" ) ) {
4280 // Book can teach you something and hasn't been identified yet
4281 ret = c_red;
4282 } else {
4283 // "just for fun" book that they haven't read yet
4284 ret = c_magenta;
4285 }
4286 }
4287 return ret;
4288}
edible_rating::no_tool
@ no_tool

@ nausea

◆ conductive()

bool item::conductive ( ) const

Whether the items is conductive.

Definition at line 6471 of file item.cpp.

6472{
6473 if( is_null() ) {
6474 return false;
6475 }
6476
6477 if( has_flag( flag_CONDUCTIVE ) ) {
6478 return true;
6479 }
6480
6481 if( has_flag( flag_NONCONDUCTIVE ) ) {
6482 return false;
6483 }
6484
6485 // If any material has electricity resistance equal to or lower than flesh (1) we are conductive.
6486 const std::vector<const material_type *> &mats = made_of_types();
6487 return std::any_of( mats.begin(), mats.end(), []( const material_type * mt ) {
6488 return mt->elec_resist() <= 1;
6489 } );
6490}

6053{
6054 if( is_null() ) {
6055 return 0;
6056 }
6057
6058 const int base_thickness = get_thickness();
6059 float resist = 0;
6060 float mod = get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_cut );
6061 int eff_thickness = 1;
6062
6063 // base resistance
6064 // Don't give reinforced items +armor, just more resistance to ripping
6065 const int dmg = damage_level( 4 );
6066 const int eff_damage = to_self ? std::min( dmg, 0 ) : std::max( dmg, 0 );
6067 eff_thickness = std::max( 1, base_thickness - eff_damage );
6068
6069 const std::vector<const material_type *> mat_types = made_of_types();
6070 if( !mat_types.empty() ) {
6071 for( const material_type *mat : mat_types ) {
6072 resist += mat->cut_resist();
6073 }
6074 // Average based on number of materials.
6075 resist /= mat_types.size();
6076 }
6077
6078 return std::lround( ( resist * eff_thickness ) + mod );
6079}

◆ damage_level()

int item::damage_level ( int  max) const

Scale item damage to the given number of levels.

This function is here mostly for back-compatibility. It should not be used when doing continuous math with the damage value: use damage() instead.

For example, for max = 4, min_damage = -1000, max_damage = 4000 damage level -1000 ~ -1 -1 0 0 1 ~ 1333 1 1334 ~ 2666 2 2667 ~ 3999 3 4000 4

Parameters
maxMaximum number of levels

Definition at line 702 of file item.cpp.

703{
704 if( damage_ == 0 || max <= 0 ) {
705 return 0;
706 } else if( max_damage() <= 1 ) {
707 return damage_ > 0 ? max : damage_;
708 } else if( damage_ < 0 ) {
709 return -( ( max - 1 ) * ( -damage_ - 1 ) / ( max_damage() - 1 ) + 1 );
710 } else {
711 return ( max - 1 ) * ( damage_ - 1 ) / ( max_damage() - 1 ) + 1;
712 }
713}

References damage_, and max_damage().

Referenced by Character::armor_absorb(), bash_resist(), bullet_resist(), activity_handlers::butcher_finish(), butchery_drops_harvest(), iuse::chainsaw_off(), crafting::complete_disassemble(), iuse::cs_lajatang_off(), cut_resist(), salvage_actor::cut_up(), damage_color(), vehicle_part::damage_level(), damage_melee(), damage_symbol(), veh_interact::do_repair(), durability_indicator(), gun_damage(), gun_dispersion(), avatar_funcs::gunmod_installation_odds(), monster::init_from_item(), vehicle_part::properties_to_item(), ready_to_revive(), repair_item_actor::repair_chance(), game::save_cyborg(), iuse::trimmer_off(), and fireweapon_off_actor::use().

◆ damage_melee()

int item::damage_melee ( damage_type  dt) const

Damage of given type caused when this item is used as melee weapon.

Definition at line 5181 of file item.cpp.

5182{
5183 assert( dt >= DT_NULL && dt < NUM_DT );
5184 if( is_null() ) {
5185 return 0;
5186 }
5187
5188 // effectiveness is reduced by 10% per damage level
5189 int res = type->melee[ dt ];
5190 res -= res * std::max( damage_level( 4 ), 0 ) * 0.1;
5191
5192 // apply type specific flags
5193 switch( dt ) {
5194 case DT_BASH:
5195 if( has_flag( flag_REDUCED_BASHING ) ) {
5196 res *= 0.5;
5197 }
5198 break;
5199
5200 case DT_CUT:
5201 case DT_STAB:
5202 if( has_flag( flag_DIAMOND ) ) {
5203 res *= 1.3;
5204 }
5205 break;
5206
5207 default:
5208 break;
5209 }
5210
5211 // consider any melee gunmods
5212 if( is_gun() ) {
5213 const std::vector<const item *> &mods = gunmods();
5214 return std::accumulate( mods.begin(), mods.end(), res, [dt]( int last_max, const item * it ) {
5215 return it->has_flag( flag_MELEE_GUNMOD ) ? std::max( last_max, it->damage_melee( dt ) ) : last_max;
5216 } );
5217
5218 }
5219
5220 switch( dt ) {
5221 case DT_BASH:
5222 res += bonus_from_enchantments_wielded( res, enchant_vals::mod::ITEM_DAMAGE_BASH, true );
5223 break;
5224 case DT_CUT:
5225 res += bonus_from_enchantments_wielded( res, enchant_vals::mod::ITEM_DAMAGE_CUT, true );
5226 break;
5227 case DT_STAB:
5228 res += bonus_from_enchantments_wielded( res, enchant_vals::mod::ITEM_DAMAGE_STAB, true );
5229 break;
5230 default:
5231 break;
5232 }
5233
5234 return std::max( res, 0 );
5235}

◆ damage_resist()

int item::damage_resist ( damage_type  dt,
bool  to_self = false 
) const

Resistance provided by this item against damage type given by an enum.

Definition at line 6364 of file item.cpp.

6365{
6366 switch( dt ) {
6367 case DT_NULL:
6368 case NUM_DT:
6369 return 0;
6370 case DT_TRUE:
6371 case DT_BIOLOGICAL:
6372 case DT_ELECTRIC:
6373 case DT_COLD:
6374 // Currently hardcoded:
6375 // Items can never be damaged by those types
6376 // But they provide 0 protection from them
6377 return to_self ? INT_MAX : 0;
6378 case DT_BASH:
6379 return bash_resist( to_self );
6380 case DT_CUT:
6381 return cut_resist( to_self );
6382 case DT_ACID:
6383 return acid_resist( to_self );
6384 case DT_STAB:
6385 return stab_resist( to_self );
6386 case DT_HEAT:
6387 return fire_resist( to_self );
6388 case DT_BULLET:
6389 return bullet_resist( to_self );
6390 default:
6391 debugmsg( "Invalid damage type: %d", dt );
6392 }
6393
6394 return 0;
6395}

◆ detonate()

bool item::detonate ( const tripoint &  p,
std::vector< item > &  drops 
)

Detonates the item and adds remains (if any) to drops.

Returns true if the item actually detonated, potentially destroying other items and invalidating iterators. Should NOT be called on an item on the map, but on a local copy.

Definition at line 8742 of file item.cpp.

8743{
8744 if( type->explosion ) {
8745 explosion_handler::explosion( p, type->explosion, activated_by.get() );
8746 return true;
8747 } else if( type->ammo && ( type->ammo->special_cookoff || type->ammo->cookoff ) ) {
8748 int charges_remaining = charges;
8749 const int rounds_exploded = rng( 1, charges_remaining );
8750 // Yank the exploding item off the map for the duration of the explosion
8751 // so it doesn't blow itself up.
8752 const islot_ammo &ammo_type = *type->ammo;
8753
8754 if( ammo_type.special_cookoff ) {
8755 // If it has a special effect just trigger it.
8756 apply_ammo_effects( p, ammo_type.ammo_effects, activated_by.get() );
8757 }
8758 charges_remaining -= rounds_exploded;
8759 if( charges_remaining > 0 ) {
8760 item temp_item = *this;
8761 temp_item.charges = charges_remaining;
8762 drops.push_back( temp_item );
8763 }
8764
8765 return true;
8766 } else if( !contents.empty() && ( !type->magazine || !type->magazine->protects_contents ) ) {
8767 std::vector<item *> removed_items;
8768 bool detonated = false;
8769 for( item *it : contents.all_items_top() ) {
8770 if( it->detonate( p, drops ) ) {
8771 removed_items.push_back( it );
8772 detonated = true;
8773 }
8774 }
8775 for( item *it : removed_items ) {
8776 remove_item( *it );
8777 }
8778 return detonated;
8779 }
8780
8781 return false;
8782}

◆ display_stacked_with()

bool item::display_stacked_with ( const item &  rhs,
bool  check_components = false 
) const

Whether two items should stack when displayed in a inventory menu.

This is different from stacks_with, when two previously non-stackable items are now stackable and mergeable because, for example, they reaches the same temperature. This is necessary to avoid misleading stacks like "3 items-count-by-charge (5)".

Definition at line 885 of file item.cpp.

calculate effective dps against a stock set of monsters.

by default, assume g->u is wielding for_display - include monsters intended for display purposes for_calc - include monsters intended for evaluation purposes for_display and for_calc are inclusive

1434 if( ( comp_mon.second.display != for_display ) &&
1435 ( comp_mon.second.evaluate != for_calc ) ) {
1436 continue;
1437 }
1438 monster test_mon = monster( comp_mon.second.mon_id );
1439 results[ comp_mon.first.translated() ] = effective_dps( guy, test_mon );
1440 }
1441 return results;
1442}

◆ durability_indicator()

std::string item::durability_indicator ( bool  include_intact = false) const

Provides a prefix for the durability state of the item.

with ITEM_HEALTH_BAR enabled, returns a symbol with color tag already applied. Otherwise, returns an adjective. if include_intact is true, this provides a string for the corner case of a player with ITEM_HEALTH_BAR disabled, but we need still a string for some reason.

Definition at line 6309 of file item.cpp.

6310{
6311 std::string outputstring;
6312
6313 if( damage() < 0 ) {
6314 if( get_option<bool>( "ITEM_HEALTH_BAR" ) ) {
6315 outputstring = colorize( damage_symbol() + "\u00A0", damage_color() );
6316 } else if( is_gun() ) {
6317 outputstring = pgettext( "damage adjective", "accurized " );
6318 } else {
6319 outputstring = pgettext( "damage adjective", "reinforced " );

6321 } else if( has_flag( flag_CORPSE ) ) {
6322 if( damage() > 0 ) {
6323 switch( damage_level( 4 ) ) {
6324 case 1:
6325 outputstring = pgettext( "damage adjective", "bruised " );
6326 break;
6327 case 2:
6328 outputstring = pgettext( "damage adjective", "damaged " );

6332 break;
6333 default:

◆ effective_dps()

double item::effective_dps ( const player &  guy,
const monster &  mon 
) const

Calculate the item's effective damage per second past armor when wielded by a character against a monster.

Definition at line 1326 of file item.cpp.

1327{
1328 const float mon_dodge = mon.get_dodge();
1329 float base_hit = guy.get_dex() / 4.0f + guy.get_hit_weapon( *this );
1330 base_hit *= std::max( 0.25f, 1.0f - guy.encumb( bp_torso ) / 100.0f );
1331 float mon_defense = mon_dodge + mon.size_melee_penalty() / 5.0;
1332 constexpr double hit_trials = 10000.0;
1333 const int rng_mean = std::max( std::min( static_cast<int>( base_hit - mon_defense ), 20 ),
1334 -20 ) + 20;
1335 double num_all_hits = hits_by_accuracy[ rng_mean ];
1336 /* critical hits have two chances to occur: triple critical hits happen much less frequently,
1337 * and double critical hits can only occur if a hit roll is more than 1.5 * monster dodge.
1338 * Not the hit roll used to determine the attack, another one.
1339 * the way the math works, some percentage of the total hits are eligible to be double
1340 * critical hits, and the rest are eligible to be triple critical hits, but in each case,
1341 * only some small percent of them actually become critical hits.
1342 */
1343 const int rng_high_mean = std::max( std::min( static_cast<int>( base_hit - 1.5 * mon_dodge ),
1344 20 ), -20 ) + 20;
1345 double num_high_hits = hits_by_accuracy[ rng_high_mean ] * num_all_hits / hit_trials;
1346 double double_crit_chance = guy.crit_chance( 4, 0, *this );
1347 double crit_chance = guy.crit_chance( 0, 0, *this );
1348 double num_low_hits = std::max( 0.0, num_all_hits - num_high_hits );
1349
1350 double moves_per_attack = guy.attack_cost( *this );
1351 // attacks that miss do no damage but take time
1352 double total_moves = ( hit_trials - num_all_hits ) * moves_per_attack;
1353 double total_damage = 0.0;
1354 double num_crits = std::min( num_low_hits * crit_chance + num_high_hits * double_crit_chance,
1355 num_all_hits );
1356 // critical hits are counted separately
1357 double num_hits = num_all_hits - num_crits;
1358 // sum average damage past armor and return the number of moves required to achieve
1359 // that damage
1360 const auto calc_effective_damage = [ &, moves_per_attack]( const double num_strikes,
1361 const bool crit, const player & guy, const monster & mon ) {
1362 monster temp_mon = mon;
1363 double subtotal_damage = 0;
1364 damage_instance base_damage;
1365 guy.roll_all_damage( crit, base_damage, true, *this );
1366 damage_instance dealt_damage = base_damage;
1367 temp_mon.absorb_hit( bodypart_id( "torso" ), dealt_damage );
1368 dealt_damage_instance dealt_dams;
1369 for( const damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_damage.damage_units ) {
1370 int cur_damage = 0;
1371 int total_pain = 0;
1372 temp_mon.deal_damage_handle_type( dmg_unit, bodypart_id( "torso" ), cur_damage, total_pain );
1373 if( cur_damage > 0 ) {
1374 dealt_dams.dealt_dams[ dmg_unit.type ] += cur_damage;
1375 }
1376 }
1377 double damage_per_hit = dealt_dams.total_damage();
1378 subtotal_damage = damage_per_hit * num_strikes;
1379 double subtotal_moves = moves_per_attack * num_strikes;
1380
1381 if( has_technique( rapid_strike ) ) {
1382 monster temp_rs_mon = mon;
1383 damage_instance rs_base_damage;
1384 guy.roll_all_damage( crit, rs_base_damage, true, *this );
1385 damage_instance dealt_rs_damage = rs_base_damage;
1386 for( damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_rs_damage.damage_units ) {
1387 dmg_unit.damage_multiplier *= 0.66;
1388 }
1389 temp_rs_mon.absorb_hit( bodypart_id( "torso" ), dealt_rs_damage );
1390 dealt_damage_instance rs_dealt_dams;
1391 for( const damage_unit &dmg_unit : dealt_rs_damage.damage_units ) {
1392 int cur_damage = 0;
1393 int total_pain = 0;
1394 temp_rs_mon.deal_damage_handle_type( dmg_unit, bodypart_id( "torso" ), cur_damage, total_pain );
1395 if( cur_damage > 0 ) {
1396 rs_dealt_dams.dealt_dams[ dmg_unit.type ] += cur_damage;
1397 }
1398 }
1399 double rs_damage_per_hit = rs_dealt_dams.total_damage();
1400 subtotal_moves *= 0.5;
1401 subtotal_damage *= 0.5;
1402 subtotal_moves += moves_per_attack * num_strikes * 0.33;
1403 subtotal_damage += rs_damage_per_hit * num_strikes * 0.5;
1404 }
1405 return std::make_pair( subtotal_moves, subtotal_damage );
1406 };
1407 std::pair<double, double> crit_summary = calc_effective_damage( num_crits, true, guy, mon );
1408 total_moves += crit_summary.first;
1409 total_damage += crit_summary.second;
1410 std::pair<double, double> summary = calc_effective_damage( num_hits, false, guy, mon );
1411 total_moves += summary.first;
1412 total_damage += summary.second;
1413 return total_damage * to_moves<double>( 1_seconds ) / total_moves;
1414}

This works for guns and tools that accept liquid ammo.

3799 }
3800 }
3801 if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_BREWABLE_PRODUCTS ) ) {
3802 for( const itype_id &res : brewed.brewing_results() ) {
3803 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3804 string_format( _( "* Fermenting this will produce "
3805 "<neutral>%s</neutral>." ),
3806 nname( res, brewed.charges ) ) ) );
3807 }
3808 }
3809 }
3810
3811 if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_FAULTS ) ) {
3812 for( const fault_id &e : faults ) {
3813 //~ %1$s is the name of a fault and %2$s is the description of the fault
3814 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", string_format( _( "* <bad>%1$s</bad>. %2$s" ),
3815 e.obj().name(), e.obj().description() ) );
3816 }
3817 }
3818
3819 // does the item fit in any holsters?
3820 std::vector<const itype *> holsters = item_controller->find( [this]( const itype & e ) {
3821 if( !e.can_use( "holster" ) ) {
3822 return false;
3823 }
3824 const holster_actor *ptr = dynamic_cast<const holster_actor *>
3825 ( e.get_use( "holster" )->get_actor_ptr() );
3826 return ptr->can_holster( *this );
3827 } );
3828
3829 if( !holsters.empty() && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_HOLSTERS ) ) {
3830 insert_separation_line( info );
3831 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", _( "<bold>Can be stored in</bold>: " ) +
3832 enumerate_as_string( holsters.begin(), holsters.end(),
3833 []( const itype * e ) {
3834 return e->nname( 1 );
3835 } ) );
3836 }
3837
3838 if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_ACTIVATABLE_TRANSFORMATION ) ) {
3839 for( auto &u : type->use_methods ) {
3840 const delayed_transform_iuse *tt = dynamic_cast<const delayed_transform_iuse *>
3841 ( u.second.get_actor_ptr() );
3842 if( tt == nullptr ) {
3843 continue;
3844 }
3845 const int time_to_do = tt->time_to_do( *this );
3846 if( time_to_do <= 0 ) {
3847 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3848 _( "It's done and <info>can be activated</info>." ) ) );
3849 } else {
3850 const std::string time = to_string_clipped( time_duration::from_turns( time_to_do ) );
3851 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3852 string_format( _( "It will be done in %s." ),
3853 time.c_str() ) ) );
3854 }
3855 }
3856 }
3857
3858 std::map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator item_note = item_vars.find( "item_note" );
3859 std::map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator item_note_tool =
3860 item_vars.find( "item_note_tool" );
3861
3862 if( item_note != item_vars.end() && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_NOTES ) ) {
3863 insert_separation_line( info );
3864 std::string ntext;
3865 const inscribe_actor *use_actor = nullptr;
3866 if( item_note_tool != item_vars.end() ) {
3867 const use_function *use_func = itype_id( item_note_tool->second )->get_use( "inscribe" );
3868 use_actor = dynamic_cast<const inscribe_actor *>( use_func->get_actor_ptr() );
3869 }
3870 if( use_actor ) {
3871 //~ %1$s: gerund (e.g. carved), %2$s: item name, %3$s: inscription text
3872 ntext = string_format( pgettext( "carving", "%1$s on the %2$s is: %3$s" ),
3873 use_actor->gerund, tname(), item_note->second );
3874 } else {
3875 //~ %1$s: inscription text
3876 ntext = string_format( pgettext( "carving", "Note: %1$s" ), item_note->second );
3877 }
3878 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION", ntext ) );
3879 }
3880
3881 if( this->get_var( "die_num_sides", 0 ) != 0 ) {
3882 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
3883 string_format( _( "* This item can be used as a <info>die</info>, "
3884 "and has <info>%d</info> sides." ),
3885 static_cast<int>( this->get_var( "die_num_sides",
3886 0 ) ) ) );
3887 }
3888
3889 // Price and barter value
3890 const int price_preapoc = price( false ) * batch;
3891 const int price_postapoc = price( true ) * batch;
3892 if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_PRICE ) ) {
3893 insert_separation_line( info );
3894 info.push_back( iteminfo( "BASE", _( "Price: " ), _( "$<num>" ),
3895 iteminfo::is_decimal | iteminfo::lower_is_better | iteminfo::no_newline,
3896 static_cast<double>( price_preapoc ) / 100 ) );
3897 }
3898 if( price_preapoc != price_postapoc && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::BASE_BARTER ) ) {
3899 info.push_back( iteminfo( "BASE", space + _( "Barter value: " ), _( "$<num>" ),
3900 iteminfo::is_decimal | iteminfo::lower_is_better,
3901 static_cast<double>( price_postapoc ) / 100 ) );
3902 }
3903
3904 // Recipes using this item as an ingredient
3905 if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::DESCRIPTION_APPLICABLE_RECIPES ) ) {
3906 itype_id tid = contents.empty() ? typeId() : contents.front().typeId();
3907 const inventory &crafting_inv = you.crafting_inventory();
3908
3909 const recipe_subset available_recipe_subset = you.get_available_recipes( crafting_inv, nullptr,
3910 recipe_filter_by_component( tid ) );
3911 const std::set<const recipe *> &item_recipes = available_recipe_subset.of_component( tid );
3912
3913 if( item_recipes.empty() ) {
3914 insert_separation_line( info );
3915 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3916 _( "You know of nothing you could craft with it." ) ) );
3917 } else {
3918 if( item_recipes.size() > 24 ) {
3919 insert_separation_line( info );
3920 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3921 _( "You know dozens of things you could craft with it." ) ) );
3922 } else if( item_recipes.size() > 12 ) {
3923 insert_separation_line( info );
3924 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3925 _( "You could use it to craft various other things." ) ) );
3926 } else {
3927 // Extract item names from recipes and sort them
3928 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, bool>> result_names;
3929 std::transform(
3930 item_recipes.begin(), item_recipes.end(),
3931 std::back_inserter( result_names ),
3932 [&crafting_inv]( const recipe * r ) {
3933 bool can_make = r->deduped_requirements().can_make_with_inventory(
3934 crafting_inv, r->get_component_filter() );
3935 return std::make_pair( r->result_name(), can_make );
3936 } );
3937 std::sort( result_names.begin(), result_names.end(), localized_compare );
3938 const std::string recipes =
3939 enumerate_as_string( result_names.begin(), result_names.end(),
3940 []( const std::pair<std::string, bool> &p ) {
3941 if( p.second ) {
3942 return p.first;
3943 } else {
3944 return string_format( "<dark>%s</dark>", p.first );
3945 }
3946 } );
3947 insert_separation_line( info );
3948 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
3949 string_format( _( "You could use it to craft: %s" ),
3950 recipes ) ) );
3951 }
3952 }
3953 }
3954 if( get_option<bool>( "ENABLE_ASCII_ART_ITEM" ) ) {
3955 const ascii_art_id art = type->picture_id;
3956 if( art.is_valid() ) {
3957 for( const std::string &line : art->picture ) {
3958 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION", line ) );
3959 }
3960 }
3961 }
3962}

◆ find_armor_data()

const islot_armor * item::find_armor_data ( ) const

If this is an armor item, return its armor data.

You should probably not use this function, use the various functions above (like get_storage) to access armor data directly.

Definition at line 6675 of file item.cpp.

6676{
6677 if( type->armor ) {
6678 return &*type->armor;
6679 }
6680 // Currently the only way to make a non-armor item into armor is to install a gun mod.
6681 // The gunmods are stored in the items contents, as are the contents of a container, and the
6682 // tools in a tool belt (a container actually), or the ammo in a quiver (container again).
6683 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
6684 if( mod->type->armor ) {
6685 return &*mod->type->armor;
6686 }
6687 }
6688 return nullptr;
6689}

6155{
6156 if( to_self ) {
6157 // Fire damages items in a different way
6158 return INT_MAX;
6159 }
6160
6161 float resist = 0.0;
6162 float mod = get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_fire );
6163 if( is_null() ) {
6164 return 0.0;
6165 }
6166
6167 const std::vector<const material_type *> mat_types = made_of_types();
6168 if( !mat_types.empty() ) {
6169 for( const material_type *mat : mat_types ) {
6170 resist += mat->fire_resist();
6171 }
6172 // Average based on number of materials.
6173 resist /= mat_types.size();
6174 }
6175

6178 // Iron resists immersion in magma, iron-clad knight won't.
6179 resist *= env / 10.0f;
6180 }
6181

◆ flammable()

bool item::flammable ( int  threshold = 0) const

Whether the items is flammable.

(Make sure to keep this in sync with fire code in fields.cpp)

Parameters
thresholdItem is flammable if it provides more fuel than threshold.

Definition at line 8309 of file item.cpp.

8310{
8311 const std::vector<const material_type *> &mats = made_of_types();
8312 if( mats.empty() ) {
8313 // Don't know how to burn down something made of nothing.
8314 return false;
8315 }
8316
8317 int flammability = 0;
8318 units::volume volume_per_turn = 0_ml;
8319 for( const material_type *m : mats ) {
8320 const mat_burn_data &bd = m->burn_data( 1 );
8321 if( bd.immune ) {
8322 // Made to protect from fire
8323 return false;
8324 }
8325
8326 flammability += bd.fuel;
8327 volume_per_turn += bd.volume_per_turn;
8328 }
8329
8330 if( threshold == 0 || flammability <= 0 ) {
8331 return flammability > 0;
8332 }
8333
8334 volume_per_turn /= mats.size();
8335 units::volume vol = base_volume();
8336 if( volume_per_turn > 0_ml && volume_per_turn < vol ) {
8337 flammability = flammability * volume_per_turn / vol;
8338 } else {
8339 // If it burns well, it provides a bonus here
8340 flammability *= vol / units::legacy_volume_factor;
8341 }
8342
8343 return flammability > threshold;
8344}
mat_burn_data
Contains burning parameters for a given material.
Definition: fire.h:46

bool immune
If this is true, an object will not burn or be destroyed by fire.

If non-zero and lower than item's volume, scale burning by volume_penalty / volume.
Definition: fire.h:50

float fuel
Fuel contributed per tick when this material burns.

1676 you.compute_nutrient_range( *food_item, recipe_id( recipe_exemplar ) );
1677 }

1687 "<color_red>recipe loops</color>." ) );

1697 info.push_back( iteminfo( "FOOD", _( "-" ),
1698 "", iteminfo::no_newline, max_nutr.kcal ) );

1703 food_item->get_comestible()->quench ) );
1704 }
1705 }
1706

1709 info.push_back( iteminfo( "FOOD", _( "Enjoyability: " ), fun_for_food_item.first ) );
1710 }
1711

1713 info.push_back( iteminfo( "FOOD", _( "Portions: " ),
1714 std::abs( static_cast<int>( food_item->charges ) * batch ) ) );
1715 }
1716 if( food_item->corpse != nullptr && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_SMELL ) &&
1717 ( debug || ( g != nullptr && ( you.has_trait( trait_CARNIVORE ) ||
1718 you.has_artifact_with( AEP_SUPER_CLAIRVOYANCE ) ) ) ) ) {
1719 info.push_back( iteminfo( "FOOD", _( "Smells like: " ) + food_item->corpse->nname() ) );
1720 }
1721
1722 auto format_vitamin = [&]( const std::pair<vitamin_id, int> &v, bool display_vitamins ) {
1723 const bool is_vitamin = v.first->type() == vitamin_type::VITAMIN;
1724 // only display vitamins that we actually require
1725 if( you.vitamin_rate( v.first ) == 0_turns || v.second == 0 ||
1726 display_vitamins != is_vitamin || v.first->has_flag( flag_NO_DISPLAY ) ) {
1727 return std::string();
1728 }
1729 const double multiplier = you.vitamin_rate( v.first ) / 1_days * 100;
1730 const int min_value = min_nutr.get_vitamin( v.first );
1731 const int max_value = v.second;
1732 const int min_rda = std::lround( min_value * multiplier );
1733 const int max_rda = std::lround( max_value * multiplier );
1734 const std::string format = min_rda == max_rda ? "%s (%i%%)" : "%s (%i-%i%%)";
1735 return string_format( format, v.first->name(), min_value, max_value );
1736 };
1737
1738 const auto max_nutr_vitamins = sorted_lex( max_nutr.vitamins );
1739 const std::string required_vits = enumerate_as_string(
1740 max_nutr_vitamins.begin(),
1741 max_nutr_vitamins.end(),
1742 [&]( const std::pair<vitamin_id, int> &v ) {
1743 return format_vitamin( v, true );
1744 } );
1745
1746 const std::string effect_vits = enumerate_as_string(
1747 max_nutr_vitamins.begin(),
1748 max_nutr_vitamins.end(),
1749 [&]( const std::pair<vitamin_id, int> &v ) {
1750 return format_vitamin( v, false );
1751 } );
1752
1753 if( !required_vits.empty() && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_VITAMINS ) ) {
1754 info.emplace_back( "FOOD", _( "Vitamins (RDA): " ), required_vits );
1755 }
1756
1757 if( !effect_vits.empty() && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_VIT_EFFECTS ) ) {
1758 info.emplace_back( "FOOD", _( "Other contents: " ), effect_vits );
1759 }
1760
1761 insert_separation_line( info );
1762
1763 if( you.allergy_type( *food_item ) != morale_type( "morale_null" ) ) {
1764 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1765 _( "* This food will cause an <bad>allergic reaction</bad>." ) );
1766 }
1767
1768 if( food_item->has_flag( flag_CANNIBALISM ) &&
1769 parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_CANNIBALISM ) ) {
1770 if( !you.has_trait_flag( trait_flag_CANNIBAL ) ) {
1771 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1772 _( "* This food contains <bad>human flesh</bad>." ) );
1773 } else {
1774 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1775 _( "* This food contains <good>human flesh</good>." ) );
1776 }
1777 }
1778
1779 if( food_item->is_tainted() && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_CANNIBALISM ) ) {
1780 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1781 _( "* This food is <bad>tainted</bad> and will poison you." ) );
1782 }
1783
1784 ///\EFFECT_SURVIVAL >=3 allows detection of poisonous food
1785 if( food_item->has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_POISON ) && you.get_skill_level( skill_survival ) >= 3 &&
1786 parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_POISON ) ) {
1787 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1788 _( "* On closer inspection, this appears to be "
1789 "<bad>poisonous</bad>." ) );
1790 }
1791
1792 ///\EFFECT_SURVIVAL >=5 allows detection of hallucinogenic food
1793 if( food_item->has_flag( flag_HIDDEN_HALLU ) && you.get_skill_level( skill_survival ) >= 5 &&
1794 parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_HALLUCINOGENIC ) ) {
1795 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1796 _( "* On closer inspection, this appears to be "
1797 "<neutral>hallucinogenic</neutral>." ) );
1798 }
1799
1800 if( food_item->goes_bad() && parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_ROT ) ) {
1801 const std::string rot_time = to_string_clipped( food_item->get_shelf_life() );
1802 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1803 string_format( _( "* This food is <neutral>perishable</neutral>, "
1804 "and at room temperature has an estimated nominal "
1805 "shelf life of <info>%s</info>." ), rot_time ) );
1806
1807
1808 if( parts->test( iteminfo_parts::FOOD_ROT_STORAGE ) ) {
1809 const char *temperature_description;
1810 bool print_freshness_duration = false;
1811 // There should be a better way to do this...
1812 switch( temperature ) {
1813 case temperature_flag::TEMP_NORMAL:
1814 case temperature_flag::TEMP_HEATER: {
1815 temperature_description = _( "* Current storage conditions <bad>do not</bad> "
1816 "protect this item from rot." );
1817 }
1818 break;
1819 case temperature_flag::TEMP_FRIDGE:
1820 case temperature_flag::TEMP_ROOT_CELLAR: {
1821 temperature_description = _( "* Current storage conditions <neutral>partially</neutral> "
1822 "protect this item from rot. It will stay fresh at least <info>%s</info>." );
1823 print_freshness_duration = true;
1824 }
1825 break;
1826 case temperature_flag::TEMP_FREEZER: {
1827 temperature_description = _( "* Current storage conditions <good>fully</good> "
1828 "protect this item from rot. It will stay fresh indefinitely." );
1829 }
1830 break;
1831 default: {
1832 temperature_description = "BUGGED TEMPERATURE INFO";
1833 }
1834 }
1835
1836 if( print_freshness_duration ) {
1837 time_duration remaining_fresh = food_item->minimum_freshness_duration( temperature );
1838 std::string time_string = to_string_clipped( remaining_fresh );
1839 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", string_format( temperature_description, time_string ) );
1840 } else {
1841 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", temperature_description );
1842 }
1843 }
1844
1845 if( !food_item->rotten() ) {
1846 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION", get_freshness_description( *food_item ) );
1847 }
1848
1849 if( food_item->has_flag( flag_NO_PARASITES ) ) {
1850 info.emplace_back( "DESCRIPTION",
1851 _( "* It seems that deep freezing <good>killed all "
1852 "parasites</good>." ) );
1853 }
1854 if( food_item->rotten() ) {
1855 if( you.has_bionic( bio_digestion ) ) {
1856 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
1857 _( "This food has started to <neutral>rot</neutral>, "
1858 "but <info>your bionic digestion can tolerate "
1859 "it</info>." ) ) );
1860 } else if( you.has_trait( trait_SAPROVORE ) ) {
1861 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
1862 _( "This food has started to <neutral>rot</neutral>, "
1863 "but <info>you can tolerate it</info>." ) ) );
1864 } else {
1865 info.push_back( iteminfo( "DESCRIPTION",
1866 _( "This food has started to <bad>rot</bad>. "
1867 "<info>Eating</info> it would be a <bad>very bad "
1868 "idea</bad>." ) ) );
1869 }
1870 }
1871 }
1872}

◆ get_available_recipes()

std::vector< std::pair< const recipe *, int > > item::get_available_recipes ( const player &  u) const

7104{
7105 std::vector<std::pair<const recipe *, int>> recipe_entries;
7106 if( is_book() ) {
7107 for( const islot_book::recipe_with_description_t &elem : type->book->recipes ) {
7108 if( u.get_skill_level( elem.recipe->skill_used ) >= elem.skill_level ) {
7109 recipe_entries.push_back( std::make_pair( elem.recipe, elem.skill_level ) );
7110 }
7111 }
7112 } else if( has_var( "EIPC_RECIPES" ) ) {
7113 // See einkpc_download_memory_card() in iuse.cpp where this is set.
7114 const std::string recipes = get_var( "EIPC_RECIPES" );
7115 // Capture the index one past the delimiter, i.e. start of target string.
7116 size_t first_string_index = recipes.find_first_of( ',' ) + 1;
7117 while( first_string_index != std::string::npos ) {
7118 size_t next_string_index = recipes.find_first_of( ',', first_string_index );
7119 if( next_string_index == std::string::npos ) {
7120 break;
7121 }
7122 std::string new_recipe = recipes.substr( first_string_index,
7123 next_string_index - first_string_index );

7126 recipe_entries.push_back( std::make_pair( r, r->difficulty ) );
7127 }
7128 first_string_index = next_string_index + 1;
7129 }
7130 }
7131 return recipe_entries;
7132}

◆ get_base_env_resist_w_filter()

int item::get_base_env_resist_w_filter ( ) const

Returns the base resistance to environmental effects if an item (for example a gas mask) requires a gas filter to operate and this filter is installed.

Used in iuse::gasmask to change protection of a gas mask if it has (or don't has) filters. For other applications use get_env_resist() above.

◆ get_chapters()

int item::get_chapters ( ) const

How many chapters the book has (if any).

Will be 0 if the item is not a book, or if it has no chapters at all. Each reading will "consume" a chapter, if the book has no unread chapters, it's less fun.

◆ get_coverage()

int item::get_coverage ( ) const

Returns the relative coverage that this item has when worn.

Values range from 0 (not covering anything, or no armor at all) to 100 (covering the whole body part). Items that cover more are more likely to absorb damage from attacks.

Definition at line 5893 of file item.cpp.

◆ get_covered_body_parts() [1/2]

body_part_set item::get_covered_body_parts ( ) const

Bitset of all covered body parts.

If the bit is set, the body part is covered by this item (when worn). The index of the bit should be a body part, for example:

if( some_armor.get_covered_body_parts().test( bp_head ) ) { ... }

For testing only a single body part, use covers instead. This function allows you to get the whole covering data in one call.

Definition at line 754 of file item.cpp.

755{
756 return get_covered_body_parts( get_side() );
757}

References get_covered_body_parts(), and get_side().

Referenced by npc::adjust_worn(), Character::armor_absorb(), armor_info(), Character::can_swap(), Character::can_wear(), covers(), get_covered_body_parts(), layer_item(), on_wear(), player_morale::on_worn_item_washed(), player_morale::set_worn(), and weather_effect::wet_player().

◆ get_covered_body_parts() [2/2]

body_part_set item::get_covered_body_parts ( side  s) const

Bitset of all covered body parts, from a specific side.

If the bit is set, the body part is covered by this item (when worn). The index of the bit should be a body part, for example:

if( some_armor.get_covered_body_parts().test( bp_head ) ) { ... }

For testing only a single body part, use covers instead. This function allows you to get the whole covering data in one call.

Parameters
sSpecifies the side. Will be ignored for non-sided items.

Definition at line 759 of file item.cpp.

760{
761 body_part_set res;
762
763 if( is_gun() ) {
764 // Currently only used for guns with the should strap mod, other guns might
765 // go on another bodypart.
766 res.set( bp_torso );
767 }
768
769 const islot_armor *armor = find_armor_data();
770 if( armor == nullptr ) {
771 return res;
772 }
773
774 res |= armor->covers;
775
776 if( !armor->sided ) {
777 return res; // Just ignore the side.
778 }
779
780 switch( s ) {
781 case side::BOTH:
782 case side::num_sides:
783 break;
784
785 case side::LEFT:
786 res.reset( bp_arm_r );
787 res.reset( bp_hand_r );
788 res.reset( bp_leg_r );
789 res.reset( bp_foot_r );
790 break;
791
792 case side::RIGHT:
793 res.reset( bp_arm_l );
794 res.reset( bp_hand_l );
795 res.reset( bp_leg_l );
796 res.reset( bp_foot_l );
797 break;
798 }
799
800 return res;
801}

◆ get_encumber_when_containing()

int item::get_encumber_when_containing ( const Character &  p,
const units::volume &  contents_volume 
) const

Returns the encumbrance value that this item has when worn by given player, when containing a particular volume of contents.

Returns 0 if this can not be worn at all.

Definition at line 5813 of file item.cpp.

5815{
5816 const islot_armor *t = find_armor_data();
5817 if( t == nullptr ) {
5818 // handle wearable guns (e.g. shoulder strap) as special case
5819 return is_gun() ? volume() / 750_ml : 0;
5820 }
5821 int encumber = t->encumber;
5822
5823 // Non-rigid items add additional encumbrance proportional to their volume
5824 if( !type->rigid ) {
5825 const int capacity = get_total_capacity().value();
5826
5827 if( t->max_encumber != 0 ) {
5828
5829 if( capacity > 0 ) {
5830 // Cast up to 64 to prevent overflow. Dividing before would prevent this but lose data.
5831 encumber += static_cast<int64_t>( t->max_encumber - t->encumber ) * contents_volume.value() /
5832 capacity;
5833 } else {
5834 debugmsg( "Non-rigid item (%s) without storage capacity.", tname() );
5835 }
5836 } else {
5837 encumber += contents_volume / 500_ml;
5838 }
5839 }
5840
5841 // Fit checked before changes, fitting shouldn't reduce penalties from patching.
5842 if( has_flag( flag_FIT ) && has_flag( flag_VARSIZE ) ) {
5843 encumber = std::max( encumber / 2, encumber - 10 );
5844 }
5845
5846 // TODO: Should probably have sizing affect coverage
5847 const sizing sizing_level = get_sizing( p, encumber != 0 );
5848 switch( sizing_level ) {
5849 case sizing::small_sized_human_char:
5850 case sizing::small_sized_big_char:
5851 // non small characters have a HARD time wearing undersized clothing
5852 encumber *= 3;
5853 break;
5854 case sizing::human_sized_small_char:
5855 case sizing::big_sized_small_char:
5856 // clothes bag up around smol characters and encumber them more
5857 encumber *= 2;
5858 break;
5859 default:
5860 break;
5861 }
5862
5863 encumber += static_cast<int>( std::ceil( get_clothing_mod_val( clothing_mod_type_encumbrance ) ) );
5864
5865 return encumber;
5866}

◆ get_env_resist()

int item::get_env_resist ( int  override_base_resist = 0) const

Returns the resistance to environmental effects (islot_armor::env_resist) that this item provides when worn.

See player::get_env_resist. Higher values are better. For non-armor it returns 0.

Parameters
override_base_resistPass this to artifically increase the base resistance, so that the function can take care of other modifications to resistance for you. Note that this parameter will never decrease base resistnace.

Definition at line 5756 of file item.cpp.

5760 return is_pet_armor() ? type->pet_armor->env_resist : 0;
5761 }
5762 // modify if item is a gas mask and has filter
5763 int resist_base = t->env_resist;
5764 int resist_filter = get_var( "overwrite_env_resist", 0 );
5765 int resist = std::max( { resist_base, resist_filter, override_base_resist } );
5766
5767 return std::lround( resist * get_relative_health() );
5768}

◆ get_plant_epoch()

time_duration item::get_plant_epoch ( ) const

Time it takes to grow from one stage to another.

There are 4 plant stages: seed, seedling, mature and harvest. Non-seed items return 0.

Definition at line 9767 of file item.cpp.

9768{
9769 if( !type->seed ) {
9770 return 0_turns;
9771 }
9772 // Growing times have been based around real world season length rather than
9773 // the default in-game season length to give
9774 // more accuracy for longer season lengths
9775 // Also note that seed->grow is the time it takes from seeding to harvest, this is
9776 // divided by 3 to get the time it takes from one plant state to the next.
9777 // TODO: move this into the islot_seed
9778 return type->seed->grow * calendar::season_ratio() / 3;
9779}

◆ get_quality()

int item::get_quality ( const quality_id &  id) const

EXCEPTION: Items with quality BOIL only count as such if they are empty, excluding items of their ammo type if they are tools.

Definition at line 5376 of file item.cpp.

5377{
5378 int return_quality = INT_MIN;
5379
5380 /**
5381 * EXCEPTION: Items with quality BOIL only count as such if they are empty,
5382 * excluding items of their ammo type if they are tools.
5383 */
5384 auto block_boil_filter = [this]( const item & itm ) {
5385 // We want to skip (do not block) only those : correct ammo, correct magazine, correct toolmod.Everything else should block.
5386 if( &itm == this ) {
5387 // Do not block if checking itself - we are checking only item contents not item itself.
5388 return false;
5389 } else if( itm.is_ammo() ) {
5390 return ammo_types().count( itm.ammo_type() ) == 0;
5391 } else if( itm.is_magazine() ) {
5392 // we want to return "fine for boiling" if any of the ammo types match and "blocks boiling" if none match.
5393 for( const ammotype &at : ammo_types() ) {
5394 for( const ammotype &mag_at : itm.ammo_types() ) {
5395 if( at == mag_at ) {
5396 return false;
5397 }
5398 }
5399 }
5400 return true;
5401 } else if( itm.is_toolmod() ) {
5402 return false;
5403 }
5404 return true;
5405 };
5406 // if it's has boil quality and it's empty, it's good to boil. If it's not empty and it's not a tool (it's probably a container), it's not good to boil. If it's a tool, it gets an extra chance: if it's only contents are mods or batteries, it's still good.
5407 // Also we are using inverted filter, since we don't care about items that the filter likes, we only care if it find something it doesn't like.
5408 if( id == quality_id( "BOIL" ) && !contents.empty() &&
5409 ( !is_tool() || has_item_with( block_boil_filter ) ) ) {
5410 return INT_MIN;
5411 }
5412
5413 for( const std::pair<const quality_id, int> &quality : type->qualities ) {
5414 if( quality.first == id ) {
5415 return_quality = quality.second;
5416 }
5417 }
5418 return_quality = std::max( return_quality, contents.best_quality( id ) );
5419
5420 return return_quality;
5421}
item_contents::best_quality
int best_quality(const quality_id &id) const
Definition: item_contents.cpp:228
quality_id
string_id< quality > quality_id
Definition: type_id.h:181

References ammo_types(), item_contents::best_quality(), contents, item_contents::empty(), visitable< item >::has_item_with(), is_tool(), itype::qualities, and type.

Referenced by iuse::clear_rubble(), iuse::crowbar(), dig_pit_moves_and_byproducts(), get_qualities(), bionic::get_quality(), has_quality_internal(), Character::item_with_best_of_quality(), activity_handlers::lockpicking_finish(), max_quality_internal(), and pick_lock_actor::use().

◆ get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid() [1/2]

int item::get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid ( const item &  liquid,
bool  allow_bucket = false,
std::string *  err = nullptr 
) const

How much more of this liquid (in charges) can be put in this container.

If this is not a container (or not suitable for the liquid), it returns 0. Note that mixing different types of liquid is not possible. Also note that this works for guns and tools that accept liquid ammo.

Parameters
liquidLiquid to check capacity for
allow_bucketAllow filling non-sealable containers
errMessage to print if no more material will fit

Definition at line 8418 of file item.cpp.

8420{
8421 const auto error = [ &err ]( const std::string & message ) {
8422 if( err != nullptr ) {
8423 *err = message;
8424 }
8425 return 0;
8426 };
8427
8428 int remaining_capacity = 0;
8429
8430 // TODO: (sm) is_reloadable_with and this function call each other and can recurse for
8431 // watertight containers.
8432 if( !is_container() && is_reloadable_with( liquid.typeId() ) ) {
8433 if( ammo_remaining() != 0 && ammo_current() != liquid.typeId() ) {
8434 return error( string_format( _( "You can't mix loads in your %s." ), tname() ) );
8435 }
8436 remaining_capacity = ammo_capacity() - ammo_remaining();
8437 } else if( is_container() ) {
8438 if( !type->container->watertight ) {
8439 return error( string_format( _( "That %s isn't water-tight." ), tname() ) );
8440 } else if( !type->container->seals && ( !allow_bucket || !is_bucket() ) ) {
8441 return error( string_format( is_bucket() ?
8442 _( "That %s must be on the ground or held to hold contents!" )
8443 : _( "You can't seal that %s!" ), tname() ) );
8444 } else if( !contents.empty() && contents.front().typeId() != liquid.typeId() ) {
8445 return error( string_format( _( "You can't mix loads in your %s." ), tname() ) );
8446 }
8447 remaining_capacity = liquid.charges_per_volume( get_container_capacity() );
8448 if( !contents.empty() ) {
8449 remaining_capacity -= contents.front().charges;
8450 }
8451 } else {
8452 return error( string_format( _( "That %1$s won't hold %2$s." ), tname(),
8453 liquid.tname() ) );
8454 }
8455
8456 if( remaining_capacity <= 0 ) {
8457 return error( string_format( _( "Your %1$s can't hold any more %2$s." ), tname(),
8458 liquid.tname() ) );
8459 }
8460
8461 return remaining_capacity;
8462}
