1184 // due to the iterative nature of these features, something can fit and be undersized/oversized
1185 // but that is fine because we have separate logic to adjust encumberance per each. One day we
1186 // may want to have fit be a flag that only applies if a piece of clothing is sized for you as there

item * item::get_usable_item ( const std::string &  use_name)

Checks this item and its contents (recursively) for types that have use_function with type use_name.

Returns the first item that does have such type or nullptr if none found.

◆ get_warmth()

int item::get_warmth ( ) const

Returns the warmth value that this item has when worn.

See player class for temperature related code, or player::warmth. Returned values should be positive. A value of 0 indicates no warmth from this item at all (this is also the default for non-armor).

units::angle &  direction 
) const

Directional light emission of the item.

Parameters
luminanceThe amount of light (see lightmap.cpp)
widthIf greater 0, the light is emitted in an arc, this is the angle of it.
directionThe direction of the light arc. In degrees.

8357 luminance = static_cast<float>( light.luminance );

8359 width = units::from_degrees( light.width );

8361 }

7829 std::map<gun_mode_id, gun_mode> res;
7830

7832 return res;

7834

7836 opts.push_back( this );
7837

7839
7840 // handle base item plus any auxiliary gunmods
7841 if( e->is_gun() ) {
7842 for( const std::pair<const gun_mode_id, gun_modifier_data> &m : e->type->gun->modes ) {
7843 // prefix attached gunmods, e.g. M203_DEFAULT to avoid index key collisions
7844 std::string prefix = e->is_gunmod() ? ( std::string( e->typeId() ) += "_" ) : "";
7845 std::transform( prefix.begin(), prefix.end(), prefix.begin(),
7846 static_cast<int( * )( int )>( toupper ) );
7847

7851 const_cast<item *>( e ),
7852 qty, m.second.flags() ) );
7853 }
7854
7855 // non-auxiliary gunmods may provide additional modes for the base item
7856 } else if( e->is_gunmod() ) {

7858 //checks for melee gunmod, points to gunmod
7859 if( m.first == gun_mode_REACH ) {
7860 res.emplace( m.first, gun_mode { m.second.name(), const_cast<item *>( e ),
7861 m.second.qty(), m.second.flags() } );
7862 //otherwise points to the parent gun, not the gunmod
7863 } else {
7864 res.emplace( m.first, gun_mode { m.second.name(), const_cast<item *>( this ),
7865 m.second.qty(), m.second.flags() } );

7868 }

◆ gun_dispersion()

int item::gun_dispersion ( bool  with_ammo = true,
bool  with_scaling = true 
) const

Summed dispersion of a gun, including values from mods.

Returns 0 on non-gun items.

Definition at line 7221 of file item.cpp.

7222{
7223 if( !is_gun() ) {
7224 return 0;
7225 }
7226 int dispersion_sum = type->gun->dispersion;
7227 for( const item *mod : gunmods() ) {
7228 dispersion_sum += mod->type->gunmod->dispersion;
7229 }
7230 int dispPerDamage = get_option< int >( "DISPERSION_PER_GUN_DAMAGE" );
7231 dispersion_sum += damage_level( 4 ) * dispPerDamage;
7232 dispersion_sum = std::max( dispersion_sum, 0 );

7234 dispersion_sum += ammo_data()->ammo->dispersion;
7235 }
7236 if( !with_scaling ) {
7237 return dispersion_sum;
7238 }
7239

7241 // will bake that adjustment into individual gun definitions in the future.
7242 // Absolute minimum gun dispersion is 1.
7243 double divider = get_option< float >( "GUN_DISPERSION_DIVIDER" );
7244 dispersion_sum = std::max( static_cast<int>( std::round( dispersion_sum / divider ) ), 1 );
7245
7246 return dispersion_sum;

7875{

7877 for( const std::pair<const gun_mode_id, gun_mode> &e : gun_all_modes() ) {
7878 if( e.first == mode ) {
7879 return e.second;
7880 }
7881 }
7882 }
7883 return gun_mode();
7884}

References gun_all_modes(), and is_gun().

Referenced by mattack::frag(), gun_current_mode(), mattack::rifle(), and mattack::tankgun().

Returns the sound of the gun being fired.

1785{
1786 if( !is_gun() ) {
1787 return { 0, "" };

1790 int noise = type->gun->loudness;

1792 noise += mod->type->gunmod->loudness;
1793 }
1794 if( ammo_data() ) {
1795 noise += ammo_data()->ammo->loudness;
1796 }
1797
1798 noise = std::max( noise, 0 );
1799
1800 if( ammo_current() == itype_40x46mm || ammo_current() == itype_40x53mm ) {
1801 // Grenade launchers
1802 return { 8, _( "Thunk!" ) };
1803
1804 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_12mm || ammo_current() == itype_metal_rail ) {
1805 // Railguns
1806 return { 24, _( "tz-CRACKck!" ) };
1807
1808 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_flammable || ammo_current() == itype_66mm ||
1809 ammo_current() == itype_84x246mm || ammo_current() == itype_m235 ) {
1810 // Rocket launchers and flamethrowers
1811 return { 4, _( "Fwoosh!" ) };
1812 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_arrow ) {
1813 return { noise, _( "whizz!" ) };
1814 } else if( ammo_current() == itype_bolt ) {
1815 return { noise, _( "thonk!" ) };
1816 }
1817
1818 auto fx = ammo_effects();
1819
1820 if( fx.count( ammo_effect_LASER ) || fx.count( ammo_effect_PLASMA ) ) {
1821 if( noise < 20 ) {
1822 return { noise, _( "Fzzt!" ) };
1823 } else if( noise < 40 ) {
1824 return { noise, _( "Pew!" ) };
1825 } else if( noise < 60 ) {
1826 return { noise, _( "Tsewww!" ) };
1827 } else {
1828 return { noise, _( "Kra-kow!" ) };
1829 }
1830
1831 } else if( fx.count( ammo_effect_LIGHTNING ) ) {
1832 if( noise < 20 ) {
1833 return { noise, _( "Bzzt!" ) };
1834 } else if( noise < 40 ) {
1835 return { noise, _( "Bzap!" ) };
1836 } else if( noise < 60 ) {
1837 return { noise, _( "Bzaapp!" ) };
1838 } else {
1839 return { noise, _( "Kra-koom!" ) };
1840 }
1841
1842 } else if( fx.count( ammo_effect_WHIP ) ) {
1843 return { noise, _( "Crack!" ) };
1844
1845 } else if( noise > 0 ) {
1846 if( noise < 10 ) {
1847 return { noise, burst ? _( "Brrrip!" ) : _( "plink!" ) };
1848 } else if( noise < 150 ) {
1849 return { noise, burst ? _( "Brrrap!" ) : _( "bang!" ) };
1850 } else if( noise < 175 ) {
1851 return { noise, burst ? _( "P-p-p-pow!" ) : _( "blam!" ) };
1852 } else {
1853 return { noise, burst ? _( "Kaboom!" ) : _( "kerblam!" ) };
1854 }
1855 }
1856
1857 return { 0, "" }; // silent weapons
1858}

Summed range value of a gun, including values from mods.

◆ gun_range() [2/2]

int item::gun_range ( const player *  p) const

The weapons range in map squares.

If the item has an active gunmod, it returns the range of that gunmod, the guns range is returned only when the item has no active gunmod. This function applies to guns and auxiliary gunmods. For other items, 0 is returned. It includes the range given by the ammo.

Parameters
pThe player that uses the weapon, their strength might affect this. It's optional and can be null.

Definition at line 7350 of file item.cpp.

7351{
7352 int ret = gun_range( true );
7353 if( p == nullptr ) {
7354 return ret;
7355 }
7356 if( !p->meets_requirements( *this ) ) {
7357 return 0;
7358 }
7359
7360 // Reduce bow range if player has less than minimum strength.
7361 ret *= ranged::str_draw_range_modifier( *this, *p );
7362
7363 return std::max( 0, ret );
7364}

◆ handle_craft_failure()

bool item::handle_craft_failure ( player &  crafter)

Handle failure during crafting.

Destroy components, lose progress, and set a new failure point.

Parameters
crafterthe crafting player.
Returns
whether the craft being worked on should be entirely destroyed

Definition at line 928 of file crafting.cpp.

929{
930 if( !is_craft() ) {
931 debugmsg( "handle_craft_failure() called on non-craft '%s.' Aborting.", tname() );
932 return false;
933 }
934
935 const double success_roll = crafter.crafting_success_roll( get_making() );
936 const int starting_components = this->components.size();
937 // Destroy at most 75% of the components, always a chance of losing 1 though
938 const size_t max_destroyed = std::max<size_t>( 1, components.size() * 3 / 4 );
939 for( size_t i = 0; i < max_destroyed; i++ ) {
940 // This shouldn't happen
941 if( components.empty() ) {
942 break;
943 }
944 // If we roll success, skip destroying a component
945 if( x_in_y( success_roll, 1.0 ) ) {
946 continue;
947 }
948 destroy_random_component( *this, crafter );
949 }
950 if( starting_components > 0 && this->components.empty() ) {
951 // The craft had components and all of them were destroyed.
952 return true;
953 }
954
955 // Minimum 25% progress lost, average 35%. Falls off exponentially
956 // Loss is scaled by the success roll
957 const double percent_progress_loss = rng_exponential( 0.25, 0.35 ) *
958 ( 1.0 - std::min( success_roll, 1.0 ) );
959 const int progess_loss = item_counter * percent_progress_loss;
960 crafter.add_msg_player_or_npc( _( "You mess up and lose %d%% progress." ),
961 _( "<npcname> messes up and loses %d%% progress." ), progess_loss / 100000 );
962 item_counter = clamp( item_counter - progess_loss, 0, 10000000 );
963
964 set_next_failure_point( crafter );
965
966 // Check if we can consume a new component and continue
967 if( !crafter.can_continue_craft( *this ) ) {
968 crafter.cancel_activity();
969 }
970 return false;
971}
x_in_y
bool x_in_y(const time_duration &a, const time_duration &b)
Definition: calendar.cpp:521
clamp
constexpr T clamp(const T &val, const T &min, const T &max)
Clamp first argument so that it is no lower than second and no higher than third.
Definition: cata_utility.h:145

◆ handle_pickup_ownership()

void item::handle_pickup_ownership ( Character &  c)

Definition at line 4469 of file item.cpp.

4470{
4471 if( is_owned_by( c ) ) {
4472 return;
4473 }
4474 // Add ownership to item if unowned
4475 if( owner.is_null() ) {
4476 set_owner( c );
4477 } else {
4478 Character &you = get_player_character();
4479 if( !is_owned_by( c ) && &c == &you ) {
4480 std::vector<npc *> witnesses;
4481 for( npc &elem : g->all_npcs() ) {
4482 if( rl_dist( elem.pos(), you.pos() ) < MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE && elem.get_faction() &&
4483 is_owned_by( elem ) && elem.sees( you.pos() ) ) {
4484 elem.say( "<witnessed_thievery>", 7 );
4485 npc *npc_to_add = &elem;
4486 witnesses.push_back( npc_to_add );
4487 }
4488 }
4489 if( !witnesses.empty() ) {
4490 set_old_owner( get_owner() );
4491 // Make sure there is only one witness
4492 for( npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
4493 if( guy.get_attitude() == NPCATT_RECOVER_GOODS ) {
4494 guy.set_attitude( NPCATT_NULL );
4495 }
4496 }
4497 random_entry( witnesses )->set_attitude( NPCATT_RECOVER_GOODS );
4498 // Notify the activity that we got a witness
4499 if( c.activity && !c.activity.is_null() && c.activity.id() == ACT_PICKUP ) {
4500 c.activity.str_values.clear();
4501 c.activity.str_values.emplace_back( has_thievery_witness );
4502 }
4503 }
4504 set_owner( c );
4505 }
4506 }

Whether the item has enough rot that it should get removed.

Regular shelf life perishable foods rot away completely at 2x shelf life. Corpses last 10 days

◆ in_its_container()

item item::in_its_container ( ) const

Returns this item into its default container.

If it does not have a default container, returns this. It's intended to be used like

newitem = newitem.in_its_container();

◆ info() [1/4]

std::vector< iteminfo > item::info ( ) const

Return all the information about the item and its type as a vector.

This includes the different properties of the itype (if they are visible to the player).

Parameters
partscontrols which parts of the iteminfo to return.
batchThe batch crafting number to multiply data by
Returns
The properties (encapsulated into iteminfo) are added to this vector, the vector can be used to compare them to properties of another item.

2255 // loaded into a union of those members. Now they are separate members and must be set separately.
2256 if( poison != 0 && note == 0 && !type->snippet_category.empty() ) {
2257 std::swap( note, poison );
2258 }

2263 std::swap( irradiation, poison );
2264 }
2265
2266 // erase all invalid flags (not defined in flags.json), display warning about invalid flags

2269 debugmsg( "item of type '%s' was loaded with undefined flag '%s'.", typeId().c_str(), f );
2270 return true;
2271 } else {
2272 return false;
2273 }
2274 } );
2275
2276 if( note_read ) {
2277 snip_id = SNIPPET.migrate_hash_to_id( note );
2278 } else {
2279 cata::optional<std::string> snip;
2280 if( archive.read( "snippet_id", snip ) && snip ) {
2281 snip_id = snippet_id( snip.value() );
2282 }
2283 }
2284
2285 // Compatibility for item type changes: for example soap changed from being a generic item
2286 // (item::charges -1 or 0 or anything else) to comestible (and thereby counted by charges),
2287 // old saves still have invalid charges, this fixes the charges value to the default charges.
2288 if( count_by_charges() && charges <= 0 ) {
2289 charges = item( type, calendar::start_of_cataclysm ).charges;
2290 }
2291 if( is_food() ) {
2292 active = true;
2293 }
2294 if( !active && item_tags.count( "WET" ) > 0 ) {
2295 // Some wet items from legacy saves may be inactive
2296 active = true;
2297 }
2298 std::string mode;
2299 if( archive.read( "mode", mode ) ) {
2300 // only for backward compatibility (nowadays mode is stored in item_vars)
2301 gun_set_mode( gun_mode_id( mode ) );
2302 }
2303
2304 // Books without any chapters don't need to store a remaining-chapters
2305 // counter, it will always be 0 and it prevents proper stacking.
2306 if( get_chapters() == 0 ) {
2307 for( auto it = item_vars.begin(); it != item_vars.end(); ) {
2308 if( it->first.compare( 0, 19, "remaining-chapters-" ) == 0 ) {
2309 item_vars.erase( it++ );
2310 } else {
2311 ++it;
2312 }
2313 }
2314 }
2315
2316 // Remove stored translated gerund in favor of storing the inscription tool type
2317 item_vars.erase( "item_label_type" );
2318 item_vars.erase( "item_note_type" );
2319
2320 // Activate corpses from old saves
2321 if( is_corpse() && !active ) {
2322 active = true;
2323 }
2324
2325 if( charges != 0 && !type->can_have_charges() ) {
2326 // Types that are known to have charges, but should not have them.
2327 // We fix it here, but it's expected from bugged saves and does not require a message.
2328 if( charge_removal_blacklist::get().count( type->get_id() ) == 0 ) {
2329 debugmsg( "Item %s was loaded with charges, but can not have any!", type->get_id() );
2330 }
2331 charges = 0;
2332 }
2333

2335 if( relic_data ) {

2337 }

7753{
7754 if( !mod.is_gunmod() ) {

7759 static const skill_id skill_archery( "archery" );
7760 static const std::string bow_hack_str( "bow" );

7762 if( !is_gun() ) {
7763 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "isn't a weapon" ) );
7764
7765 } else if( is_gunmod() ) {
7766 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "is a gunmod and cannot be modded" ) );

7772 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "doesn't have a slot for this mod" ) );
7773
7774 } else if( get_free_mod_locations( mod.type->gunmod->location ) <= 0 ) {
7775 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "doesn't have enough room for another %s mod" ),
7776 mod.type->gunmod->location.name() );
7777
7778 // TODO: Get rid of the "archery"->"bow" hack
7779 } else if( !mod.type->gunmod->usable.count( gun_type() ) &&
7780 !mod.type->gunmod->usable.count( typeId().str() ) &&
7781 !( gun_skill() == skill_archery && mod.type->gunmod->usable.count( bow_hack_str ) > 0 ) ) {
7782 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "cannot have a %s" ), mod.tname() );
7783
7784 } else if( typeId() == itype_hand_crossbow &&
7785 !mod.type->gunmod->usable.count( pistol_gun_type ) ) {
7786 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "isn't big enough to use that mod" ) );
7787
7788 } else if( mod.type->gunmod->location.str() == "underbarrel" &&
7789 !mod.has_flag( flag_PUMP_RAIL_COMPATIBLE ) && has_flag( flag_PUMP_ACTION ) ) {
7790 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "can only accept small mods on that slot" ) );
7791
7792 } else if( !mod.type->mod->acceptable_ammo.empty() ) {
7793 bool compat_ammo = false;
7794 for( const ammotype &at : mod.type->mod->acceptable_ammo ) {
7795 if( ammo_types( false ).count( at ) ) {
7796 compat_ammo = true;
7797 }
7798 }
7799 if( !compat_ammo ) {
7800 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure(
7801 _( "%1$s cannot be used on item with no compatible ammo types" ), mod.tname( 1 ) );
7802 }
7803 } else if( mod.typeId() == itype_waterproof_gunmod && has_flag( flag_WATERPROOF_GUN ) ) {
7804 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "is already waterproof" ) );
7805
7806 } else if( mod.typeId() == itype_tuned_mechanism && has_flag( flag_NEVER_JAMS ) ) {
7807 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "is already eminently reliable" ) );
7808
7809 } else if( mod.typeId() == itype_brass_catcher && has_flag( flag_RELOAD_EJECT ) ) {
7810 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "cannot have a brass catcher" ) );
7811
7812 } else if( ( !mod.type->mod->ammo_modifier.empty() || !mod.type->mod->magazine_adaptor.empty() )
7813 && ( ammo_remaining() > 0 || magazine_current() ) ) {
7814 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "must be unloaded before installing this mod" ) );
7815 }
7816
7817 for( const gunmod_location &slot : mod.type->gunmod->blacklist_mod ) {
7818 if( get_mod_locations().count( slot ) ) {
7819 return ret_val<bool>::make_failure( _( "cannot be installed on a weapon with \"%s\"" ),
7820 slot.name() );
7821 }
7822 }
7823
7824 return ret_val<bool>::make_success();
7825}
gunmod_location::name
std::string name() const
Returns the translated name.
Definition: itype.cpp:15
item::gun_type

1236{
1237 // owner.is_null() implies faction_id( "no_faction" ) which shouldn't happen, or no owner at all.
1238 // either way, certain situations this means the thing is available to take.
1239 // in other scenarios we actually really want to check for id == id, even for no_faction
1240 if( get_owner().is_null() ) {
1241 return available_to_take;
1242 }
1243 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
1244 debugmsg( "Character %s has no faction", c.disp_name() );
1245 return false;
1246 }

1248}

private

Helper for checking reloadability.

Definition at line 6864 of file item.cpp.

6865{
6866 // empty ammo is passed for listing possible ammo apparently, so it needs to return true.
6867 if( !is_reloadable() ) {
6868 return false;
6869 } else if( is_watertight_container() ) {
6870 if( ammo.is_empty() ) {
6871 return now ? !is_container_full() : true;
6872 } else if( ammo->phase != LIQUID ) {
6873 return false;
6874 } else {
6875 return now ? ( is_container_empty() || contents.front().typeId() == ammo ) : true;
6876 }
6877 } else if( magazine_integral() ) {
6878 if( !ammo.is_empty() ) {
6879 if( now && ammo_data() ) {
6880 if( ammo_current() != ammo ) {
6881 return false;
6882 }
6883 } else {

6886 !magazine_compatible().count( ammo ) ) {
6887 return false;
6888 }
6889 }

7690{

7692 // mods that define magazine_adaptor may override the items usual magazines

7695 if( !m->type->mod->magazine_adaptor.empty() ) {

7697 if( m->type->mod->magazine_adaptor.count( atype ) ) {

7701 }
7702 return mags;
7703 }

◆ make_corpse()

item item::make_corpse ( const mtype_id &  mt = string_id<mtype>::NULL_ID(),
time_point  turn = calendar::turn,
const std::string &  name = "",
int  upgrade_time = -1 
)
static

Make a corpse of the given monster type.

The monster type id must be valid (see MonsterGenerator::get_all_mtypes).

The turn parameter sets the birthday of the corpse, in other words: the turn when the monster died. Because corpses are removed from the map when they reach a certain age, one has to be careful when placing corpses with a birthday of 0. They might be removed immediately when the map is loaded without been seen by the player.

The name parameter can be used to give the corpse item a name. This is used instead of the monster type name ("corpse of X" instead of "corpse of bear").

With the default parameters it makes a human corpse, created at the current turn.

Definition at line 508 of file item.cpp.

510{
511 if( !mt.is_valid() ) {
512 debugmsg( "tried to make a corpse with an invalid mtype id" );
513 }
514
515 std::string corpse_type = mt == mtype_id::NULL_ID() ? "corpse_generic_human" : "corpse";
516
517 item result( corpse_type, turn );
518 result.corpse = &mt.obj();
519
520 if( result.corpse->has_flag( MF_REVIVES ) ) {
521 if( one_in( 20 ) ) {
522 result.set_flag( "REVIVE_SPECIAL" );
523 }
524 result.set_var( "upgrade_time", std::to_string( upgrade_time ) );
525 }
526
527 // This is unconditional because the const itemructor above sets result.name to
528 // "human corpse".
529 result.corpse_name = name;
530
531 return result;
532}
to_string
std::string to_string(const time_duration &d)
Returns a string showing a duration.
Definition: calendar.cpp:327
one_in
bool one_in(int chance)
Definition: rng.cpp:65

References debugmsg, string_id< T >::is_valid(), MF_REVIVES, om_direction::name(), string_id< mtype >::NULL_ID(), string_id< T >::obj(), one_in(), to_string(), and calendar::turn.

◆ merge_charges()

bool item::merge_charges ( const item &  rhs)

Merge charges of the other item into this item.

Returns
true if the items have been merged, otherwise false. Merging is only done for items counted by charges (count_by_charges) and items that stack together (stacks_with).

Definition at line 977 of file item.cpp.

978{
979 if( !count_by_charges() || !stacks_with( rhs ) ) {
980 return false;
981 }
982 // Prevent overflow when either item has "near infinite" charges.
983 if( charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES / 2 || rhs.charges >= INFINITE_CHARGES / 2 ) {
984 charges = INFINITE_CHARGES;
985 return true;
986 }
987 // We'll just hope that the item counter represents the same thing for both items
988 if( item_counter > 0 || rhs.item_counter > 0 ) {
989 item_counter = ( static_cast<double>( item_counter ) * charges + static_cast<double>
990 ( rhs.item_counter ) * rhs.charges ) / ( charges + rhs.charges );
991 }
992 charges += rhs.charges;
993 return true;
994}

References charges, count_by_charges(), INFINITE_CHARGES, item_counter, and stacks_with().

◆ mod_energy()

units::energy item::mod_energy ( const units::energy &  qty)

Add or remove energy from a battery.

If adding the specified energy quantity would go over the battery's capacity fill the battery and ignore the remainder. If adding the specified energy quantity would reduce the battery's charge level below 0 do nothing and return how far below 0 it would have gone.

Parameters
qtyenergy quantity to add (can be negative)
Returns
0 valued energy quantity on success

Definition at line 573 of file item.cpp.

574{
575 if( !is_battery() ) {
576 debugmsg( "Tried to set energy of non-battery item" );
577 return 0_J;
578 }
579
580 units::energy val = energy_remaining() + qty;
581 if( val < 0_J ) {
582 return val;
583 } else if( val > type->battery->max_capacity ) {
584 energy = type->battery->max_capacity;
585 } else {
586 energy = val;
587 }
588 return 0_J;
589}

References itype::battery, debugmsg, energy, energy_remaining(), is_battery(), and type.

◆ nname()

std::string item::nname ( const itype_id &  id,
unsigned int  quantity = 1 
)
static

Returns the translated item name for the item with given id.

The name is in the proper plural form as specified by the quantity parameter. This is roughly equivalent to creating an item instance and calling tname, however this function does not include strings like "(fresh)".

◆ on_pickup()

void item::on_pickup ( Character &  p)

Callback when a player starts carrying the item.

The item is already in the inventory and is called from there. This is not called when the item is added to the inventory from worn vector or weapon slot. The item is considered already carried.

4315 for( std::pair< body_part, int > &mod_part : mod_parts ) {
4316 bpid = convert_bp( mod_part.first );
4317 if( elem.get_covered_body_parts().test( mod_part.first ) &&
4318 elem.has_flag( flag_POWERARMOR_MOD ) ) {
4319 if( elem.is_sided() && elem.get_side() == bpid->part_side ) {
4320 mod_part.second++;
4321 continue;
4322 }
4323 mod_part.second++;
4324 }
4325 }
4326 }
4327 for( std::pair< body_part, int > &mod_part : mod_parts ) {
4328 bpid = convert_bp( mod_part.first );
4329 if( bpid->part_side == side::LEFT && mod_part.second > lhs ) {
4330 add_msg( _( "left" ) );
4331 lhs = mod_part.second;
4332 } else if( bpid->part_side == side::RIGHT && mod_part.second > rhs ) {
4333 add_msg( _( "right" ) );
4334 rhs = mod_part.second;
4335 }
4336 }
4337 set_side( ( lhs > rhs ) ? side::RIGHT : side::LEFT );
4338 } else {
4339 // for sided items wear the item on the side which results in least encumbrance
4340 int lhs = 0;
4341 int rhs = 0;
4342 set_side( side::LEFT );
4343 const char_encumbrance_data left_enc = p.get_encumbrance( *this );
4344 for( const body_part bp : all_body_parts ) {
4345 lhs += left_enc.elems[bp].encumbrance;
4346 }
4347
4348 set_side( side::RIGHT );
4349 const char_encumbrance_data right_enc = p.get_encumbrance( *this );
4350 for( const body_part bp : all_body_parts ) {
4351 rhs += right_enc.elems[bp].encumbrance;
4352 }
4353
4354 set_side( lhs <= rhs ? side::LEFT : side::RIGHT );
4355 }
4356 }
4357
4358 if( type->can_use( "set_transformed" ) ) {
4359 bool transform = false;
4360 const set_transformed_iuse *actor = dynamic_cast<const set_transformed_iuse *>
4361 ( this->get_use( "set_transformed" )->get_actor_ptr() );
4362 if( actor == nullptr ) {
4363 debugmsg( "iuse_actor type descriptor and actual type mismatch" );
4364 return;
4365 }
4366 std::string transform_flag = actor->dependencies;
4367 for( const auto &elem : p.worn ) {
4368 if( elem.has_flag( transform_flag ) && elem.active != active ) {
4369 transform = true;
4370 }
4371 }
4372 if( transform && actor->restricted ) {
4373 actor->bypass( *p.as_player(), *this, false, p.pos() );
4374 }
4375 }
4376
4377 // TODO: artifacts currently only work with the player character
4378 if( &p == &get_avatar() && type->artifact ) {
4379 g->add_artifact_messages( type->artifact->effects_worn );
4380 }
4381 // if game is loaded - don't want ownership assigned during char creation
4382 if( get_avatar().getID().is_valid() ) {
4383 handle_pickup_ownership( p );
4384 }
4385 p.on_item_wear( *this );
4386}

Callback when a player starts wielding the item.

The item is already in the weapon slot and is called from there.

4413 }
4414
4415 // weapons with bayonet/bipod or other generic "unhandiness"
4416 if( has_flag( flag_SLOW_WIELD ) && !is_gunmod() ) {
4417 float d = 32.0; // arbitrary linear scaling factor
4418 if( is_gun() ) {
4419 d /= std::max( p.get_skill_level( gun_skill() ), 1 );
4420 } else if( is_melee() ) {
4421 d /= std::max( p.get_skill_level( melee_skill() ), 1 );
4422 }
4423

4425 p.moves -= penalty;
4426 mv += penalty;
4427 }
4428
4429 // firearms with a folding stock or tool/melee without collapse/retract iuse

4432 if( is_gun() ) {
4433 penalty = std::max( 0, 300 - p.get_skill_level( gun_skill() ) * 10 );
4434 } else if( is_melee() ) {
4435 penalty = std::max( 0, 150 - p.get_skill_level( melee_skill() ) * 10 );
4436 }

4439 mv += penalty;

4447 msg = _( "It takes you a very long time to wield your %s." );

7147 const item_category &cat_a = get_category();
7148 const item_category &cat_b = other.get_category();
7149 if( cat_a != cat_b ) {
7150 return cat_a < cat_b;
7151 } else {
7152 const item *me = is_container() && !contents.empty() ? &contents.front() : this;
7153 const item *rhs = other.is_container() &&
7154 !other.contents.empty() ? &other.contents.front() : &other;
7155
7156 const itype *me_type = me->type;
7157 const itype *rhs_type = rhs->type;
7158 if( !me_type || !rhs_type ) {
7159 return !!me_type;
7160 }
7161
7162 if( me_type->get_id() == rhs_type->get_id() ) {
7163 if( me->is_money() ) {
7164 return me->charges > rhs->charges;
7165 }
7166 return me->charges < rhs->charges;
7167 } else {
7168 std::string n1 = me_type->nname( 1 );
7169 std::string n2 = rhs_type->nname( 1 );
7170 return localized_compare( n1, n2 );
7171 }

◆ price()

int item::price ( bool  practical) const

Returns the monetary value of an item.

If practical is false, returns pre-cataclysm market value, otherwise returns approximate post-cataclysm value.

Definition at line 4914 of file item.cpp.

4915{
4916 int res = 0;
4917
4918 visit_items( [&res, practical]( const item * e ) {
4919 if( e->rotten() ) {
4920 // TODO: Special case things that stay useful when rotten
4921 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
4922 }
4923
4924 int child = units::to_cent( practical ? e->type->price_post : e->type->price );
4925 if( e->damage() > 0 ) {
4926 // maximal damage level is 4, maximal reduction is 40% of the value.
4927 child -= child * static_cast<double>( e->damage_level( 4 ) ) / 10;
4928 }
4929
4930 if( e->count_by_charges() || e->made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
4931 // price from json data is for default-sized stack
4932 child *= e->charges / static_cast<double>( e->type->stack_size );
4933
4934 } else if( e->magazine_integral() && e->ammo_remaining() && e->ammo_data() ) {
4935 // items with integral magazines may contain ammunition which can affect the price
4936 child += item( e->ammo_data(), calendar::turn, e->charges ).price( practical );
4937
4938 } else if( e->is_tool() && e->ammo_types().empty() && e->ammo_capacity() ) {
4939 // if tool has no ammo (e.g. spray can) reduce price proportional to remaining charges
4940 child *= e->ammo_remaining() / static_cast<double>( std::max( e->type->charges_default(), 1 ) );
4941 }
4942
4943 res += child;
4944 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
4945 } );
4946
4947 return res;
4948}

◆ process() [2/2]

bool item::process ( player *  carrier,
const tripoint &  pos,
bool  activate,
temperature_flag  flag = temperature_flag::TEMP_NORMAL 
)

This is called once each turn.

It's usually only useful for active items, but can be called for inactive items without problems. It is recursive, and calls process on any contained items.

Parameters
carrierThe player / npc that carries the item. This can be null when the item is not carried by anyone (laying on ground)!
posThe location of the item on the map, same system as player::pos used. If the item is carried, it should be the location of the carrier.
activateWhether the item should be activated (true), or processed as an active item.
Returns
true if the item has been destroyed by the processing. The caller should than delete the item wherever it was stored. Returns false if the item is not destroyed.

Definition at line 9579 of file item.cpp.

9581{
9582 return process( carrier, pos, activate, flag, get_weather() );
9583}
item::process
bool process(player *carrier, const tripoint &pos, bool activate, temperature_flag flag=temperature_flag::TEMP_NORMAL)
This is called once each turn.
Definition: item.cpp:9579

◆ process_artifact()

void item::process_artifact ( player *  carrier,
const tripoint &  pos 
)

Process and apply artifact effects.

This should be called exactly once each turn, it may modify character stats (like speed, strength, ...), so call it after those have been reset.

Parameters
carrierThe character carrying the artifact, can be null.
posThe location of the artifact (should be the player location if carried).

bool item::process_corpse ( player *  carrier,

Definition at line 9107 of file item.cpp.

9108{
9109 // some corpses rez over time
9110 if( corpse == nullptr || damage() >= max_damage() ) {
9111 return false;
9112 }
9113 if( corpse->zombify_into && rotten() ) {
9114 rot -= get_shelf_life();
9115 corpse = &*corpse->zombify_into;
9116 return false;
9117 }
9118 if( !ready_to_revive( pos ) ) {
9119 return false;
9120 }
9121 if( rng( 0, volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor ) > burnt && g->revive_corpse( pos, *this ) ) {
9122 if( carrier == nullptr ) {
9123 if( get_avatar().sees( pos ) ) {
9124 if( corpse->in_species( ROBOT ) ) {
9125 add_msg( m_warning, _( "A nearby robot has repaired itself and stands up!" ) );
9126 } else {
9127 add_msg( m_warning, _( "A nearby corpse rises and moves towards you!" ) );
9128 }
9129 }
9130 } else {
9131 if( corpse->in_species( ROBOT ) ) {
9132 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning,
9133 _( "Oh dear god, a robot you're carrying has started moving!" ) );
9134 } else {
9135 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_warning,
9136 _( "Oh dear god, a corpse you're carrying has started moving!" ) );
9137 }
9138 }
9139 // Destroy this corpse item
9140 return true;
9141 }
9142
9143 return false;
9144}

9257 // checks for water
9258 bool extinguish = false;
9259 bool in_inv = carrier != nullptr && carrier->has_item( *this );
9260 bool submerged = false;
9261 bool precipitation = false;
9262 bool windtoostrong = false;
9263 bool in_veh = carrier != nullptr && carrier->in_vehicle;
9264 int windpower = get_weather().windspeed;
9265 switch( get_weather().weather_id->precip ) {
9266 case precip_class::very_light:
9267 precipitation = one_in( 100 );
9268 break;
9269 case precip_class::light:
9270 precipitation = one_in( 50 );
9271 break;
9272 case precip_class::heavy:
9273 precipitation = one_in( 10 );
9274 break;
9275 default:
9276 break;
9277 }
9278 map &here = get_map();
9279 if( in_inv && !in_veh && here.has_flag( flag_DEEP_WATER, pos ) ) {
9280 extinguish = true;
9281 submerged = true;
9282 }
9283 if( ( !in_inv && here.has_flag( flag_LIQUID, pos ) && !here.veh_at( pos ) ) ||
9284 ( precipitation && !g->is_sheltered( pos ) ) ) {
9285 extinguish = true;
9286 }
9287 if( in_inv && windpower > 5 && !g->is_sheltered( pos ) &&
9288 this->has_flag( flag_WIND_EXTINGUISH ) ) {
9289 windtoostrong = true;
9290 extinguish = true;
9291 }
9292 if( !extinguish ||
9293 ( in_inv && precipitation && carrier->weapon.has_flag( flag_RAIN_PROTECT ) ) ) {
9294 return false; //nothing happens
9295 }
9296 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
9297 if( submerged ) {
9298 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is quenched by water." ), tname() );
9299 } else if( precipitation ) {
9300 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is quenched by precipitation." ),
9301 tname() );
9302 } else if( windtoostrong ) {
9303 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "Your %s is blown out by the wind." ),
9304 tname() );
9305 }
9306 }
9307
9308 // cig dies out
9309 if( has_flag( flag_LITCIG ) ) {
9310 if( typeId() == itype_cig_lit ) {
9311 convert( itype_cig_butt );
9312 } else if( typeId() == itype_cigar_lit ) {
9313 convert( itype_cigar_butt );
9314 } else { // joint
9315 convert( itype_joint_roach );
9316 }
9317 } else { // transform (lit) items
9318 if( type->tool->revert_to ) {
9319 convert( *type->tool->revert_to );
9320 } else {
9321 type->invoke( carrier != nullptr ? *carrier : get_avatar(), *this, pos, "transform" );
9322 }
9323
9324 }
9325 active = false;
9326 // Item remains
9327 return false;
9328}

9617 if( has_flag( flag_ETHEREAL_ITEM ) ) {
9618 if( !has_var( "ethereal" ) ) {
9619 return true;
9620 }

9622 const bool processed = std::stoi( get_var( "ethereal" ) ) <= 0;
9623 if( processed && carrier != nullptr ) {
9624 carrier->add_msg_if_player( _( "Your %s disappears!" ), tname() );
9625 }
9626 return processed;
9627 }
9628
9629 if( faults.count( fault_gun_blackpowder ) ) {
9630 return process_blackpowder_fouling( carrier );
9631 }
9632
9633 avatar &you = get_avatar();
9634 if( activate ) {
9635 return type->invoke( carrier != nullptr ? *carrier : you, *this, pos );
9636 }
9637 // How this works: it checks what kind of processing has to be done
9638 // (e.g. for food, for drying towels, lit cigars), and if that matches,
9639 // call the processing function. If that function returns true, the item
9640 // has been destroyed by the processing, so no further processing has to be
9641 // done.
9642 // Otherwise processing continues. This allows items that are processed as
9643 // food and as litcig and as ...
9644
9645 // Remaining stuff is only done for active items.
9646 if( !active ) {
9647 return false;
9648 }
9649
9650 if( !is_food() && item_counter > 0 ) {
9651 item_counter--;
9652 }
9653
9654 if( item_counter == 0 && type->countdown_action ) {
9655 type->countdown_action.call( carrier ? *carrier : you, *this, false, pos );
9656 if( type->countdown_destroy ) {
9657 return true;
9658 }
9659 }
9660
9661 map &here = get_map();

9663 here.emit_field( pos, e );
9664 }
9665

9667 return true;
9668 }
9669 if( has_flag( flag_FAKE_MILL ) && process_fake_mill( carrier, pos ) ) {
9670 return true;
9671 }
9672 if( is_corpse() && process_corpse( carrier, pos ) ) {
9673 return true;
9674 }
9675 if( has_flag( flag_WET ) && process_wet( carrier, pos ) ) {
9676 // Drying items are never destroyed, but we want to exit so they don't get processed as tools.
9677 return false;
9678 }
9679 if( has_flag( flag_LITCIG ) && process_litcig( carrier, pos ) ) {
9680 return true;
9681 }
9682 if( ( has_flag( flag_WATER_EXTINGUISH ) || has_flag( flag_WIND_EXTINGUISH ) ) &&
9683 process_extinguish( carrier, pos ) ) {
9684 return false;
9685 }
9686 if( has_flag( flag_CABLE_SPOOL ) ) {
9687 // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
9688 return process_cable( carrier, pos );
9689 }
9690 if( has_flag( flag_IS_UPS ) ) {
9691 // DO NOT process this as a tool! It really isn't!
9692 return process_UPS( carrier, pos );
9693 }
9694 if( is_tool() ) {
9695 return process_tool( carrier, pos );
9696 }
9697 // All foods that go bad have temperature
9698 if( ( is_food() || is_corpse() ) &&
9699 process_rot( seals, pos, carrier, flag, weather_generator ) ) {
9700 if( is_comestible() ) {
9701 here.rotten_item_spawn( *this, pos );
9702 }
9703 return true;
9704 }
9705
9706 return false;
9707}

9181{
9182 if( !one_in( 10 ) ) {
9183 return false;
9184 }
9185 process_extinguish( carrier, pos );
9186 // process_extinguish might have extinguished the item already
9187 if( !active ) {
9188 return false;
9189 }
9190 map &here = get_map();
9191 // if carried by someone:
9192 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
9193 time_duration duration = 15_seconds;
9194 if( carrier->has_trait( trait_TOLERANCE ) ) {
9195 duration = 7_seconds;
9196 } else if( carrier->has_trait( trait_LIGHTWEIGHT ) ) {
9197 duration = 30_seconds;
9198 }
9199 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You take a puff of your %s." ), tname() );
9200 if( has_flag( flag_TOBACCO ) ) {
9201 carrier->add_effect( effect_cig, duration );
9202 } else {
9203 carrier->add_effect( effect_weed_high, duration / 2 );
9204 }
9205 carrier->moves -= 15;
9206
9207 if( ( carrier->has_effect( effect_shakes ) && one_in( 10 ) ) ) {
9208 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your shaking hand causes you to drop your %s." ),
9209 tname() );
9210 here.add_item_or_charges( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), *this );
9211 return true; // removes the item that has just been added to the map
9212 }
9213
9214 if( carrier->has_effect( effect_sleep ) ) {
9215 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You fall asleep and drop your %s." ),
9216 tname() );
9217 here.add_item_or_charges( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), *this );
9218 return true; // removes the item that has just been added to the map
9219 }
9220 } else {
9221 // If not carried by someone, but laying on the ground:
9222 if( item_counter % 5 == 0 ) {
9223 // lit cigarette can start fires
9224 if( here.flammable_items_at( pos ) ||
9225 here.has_flag( flag_FLAMMABLE, pos ) ||
9226 here.has_flag( flag_FLAMMABLE_ASH, pos ) ) {
9227 here.add_field( pos, fd_fire, 1 );
9228 }
9229 }
9230 }
9231
9232 // cig dies out
9233 if( item_counter == 0 ) {
9234 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
9235 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You finish your %s." ), tname() );
9236 }
9237 if( typeId() == itype_cig_lit ) {
9238 convert( itype_cig_butt );
9239 } else if( typeId() == itype_cigar_lit ) {
9240 convert( itype_cigar_butt );
9241 } else { // joint
9242 convert( itype_joint_roach );
9243 if( carrier != nullptr ) {
9244 carrier->add_effect( effect_weed_high, 1_minutes ); // one last puff
9245 here.add_field( pos + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) ), fd_weedsmoke, 2 );
9246 weed_msg( *carrier );
9247 }
9248 }
9249 active = false;
9250 }
9251 // Item remains
9252 return false;
9253}

◆ process_rot() [1/2]

bool item::process_rot ( bool  seals,
const tripoint &  pos,
player *  carrier,
temperature_flag  flag,
const weather_manager &  weather_generator 
)

Definition at line 8967 of file item.cpp.

8970{
8971 const time_point now = calendar::turn;
8972
8973 // if player debug menu'd the time backward it breaks stuff, just reset the
8974 // last_temp_check and last_rot_check in this case
8975 if( now - last_rot_check < 0_turns ) {
8976 last_rot_check = now;
8977 return false;
8978 }
8979
8980 // process rot at most once every 100_turns (10 min)
8981 // note we're also gated by item::processing_speed
8982 time_duration smallest_interval = 10_minutes;
8983
8984 units::temperature temp = units::from_fahrenheit( weather.get_temperature( pos ) );
8985 temp = clip_by_temperature_flag( temp, flag );
8986
8987 time_point time = last_rot_check;
8988 item_internal::scoped_goes_bad_cache _cache( this );
8989
8990 if( now - time > 1_hours ) {
8991 // This code is for items that were left out of reality bubble for long time
8992
8993 const weather_generator &wgen = weather.get_cur_weather_gen();
8994 const unsigned int seed = g->get_seed();
8995 // It's a modifier, so we need to subtract 0_f
8996 units::temperature local_mod = units::from_fahrenheit( g->new_game
8997 ? 0
8998 : get_map().get_temperature( pos ) ) - 0_f;
8999
9000 // Process the past of this item since the last time it was processed
9001 while( now - time > 1_hours ) {
9002 // Get the environment temperature
9003 time_duration time_delta = std::min( 1_hours, now - 1_hours - time );
9004 time += time_delta;
9005
9006 //Use weather if above ground, use map temp if below
9007 units::temperature env_temperature_raw;
9008 if( pos.z >= 0 ) {
9009 tripoint_abs_ms location = tripoint_abs_ms( get_map().getabs( pos ) );
9010 units::temperature weather_temperature = wgen.get_weather_temperature( location, time,
9011 calendar::config, seed );
9012 env_temperature_raw = weather_temperature + local_mod;
9013 } else {
9014 env_temperature_raw = units::from_fahrenheit( AVERAGE_ANNUAL_TEMPERATURE ) + local_mod;
9015 }
9016
9017 units::temperature env_temperature_clipped = clip_by_temperature_flag( env_temperature_raw, flag );
9018
9019 // Lookup table is in F
9020 int final_temperature_in_fahrenheit = static_cast<int>( std::round( units::to_fahrenheit<float>
9021 ( env_temperature_clipped ) ) );
9022
9023 // Calculate item rot
9024 rot += calc_rot( time, final_temperature_in_fahrenheit );
9025 last_rot_check = time;
9026
9027 if( has_rotten_away() && carrier == nullptr && !seals ) {
9028 // No need to track item that will be gone
9029 return true;
9030 }
9031 }
9032 }
9033
9034 // Remaining <1 h from above
9035 // and items that are held near the player
9036 if( now - time > smallest_interval ) {
9037 int final_temperature_in_fahrenheit = static_cast<int>( std::round( units::to_fahrenheit<float>
9038 ( temp ) ) );
9039
9040 rot += calc_rot( now, final_temperature_in_fahrenheit );
9041 last_rot_check = now;
9042
9043 return has_rotten_away() && carrier == nullptr && !seals;
9044 }
9045
9046 return false;
9047}
item::calc_rot
time_duration calc_rot(time_point time, int temp) const
Returns rot of the item since last rot calculation.
Definition: item.cpp:5644
item::has_rotten_away
bool has_rotten_away() const
Whether the item has enough rot that it should get removed.
Definition: item.cpp:8783

A point in the game time.

AVERAGE_ANNUAL_TEMPERATURE
static constexpr int AVERAGE_ANNUAL_TEMPERATURE
Average annual temperature in F used for climate, weather and temperature calculation.

9455{
9456 avatar &you = get_avatar();
9457 // items with iuse set_transformed which are restricted turn off if not attached to their dependency.
9458 if( type->can_use( "set_transformed" ) ) {
9459 const set_transformed_iuse *actor = dynamic_cast<const set_transformed_iuse *>
9460 ( this->get_use( "set_transformed" )->get_actor_ptr() );
9461 if( actor == nullptr ) {
9462 debugmsg( "iuse_actor type descriptor and actual type mismatch" );
9463 return false;
9464 }
9465 if( actor->restricted ) {
9466 if( !carrier ) {
9467 actor->bypass( carrier != nullptr ? *carrier : you, *this, false, pos );
9468 return false;
9469 } else {
9470 bool active = false;
9471 std::string transform_flag = actor->dependencies;
9472 for( const auto &elem : carrier->worn ) {
9473 if( elem.active && elem.has_flag( transform_flag ) ) {
9474 active = true;
9475 break;
9476 }
9477 }
9478 if( !active ) {
9479 actor->bypass( carrier != nullptr ? *carrier : you, *this, false, pos );
9480 return false;
9481 }

9485
9486 int energy = 0;
9487 if( type->tool->turns_per_charge > 0 &&
9488 to_turn<int>( calendar::turn ) % type->tool->turns_per_charge == 0 ) {
9489 energy = std::max( ammo_required(), 1 );
9490
9491 } else if( type->tool->power_draw > 0 ) {
9492 // power_draw in mW / 1000000 to give kJ (battery unit) per second
9493 energy = type->tool->power_draw / 1000000;
9494 // energy_bat remainder results in chance at additional charge/discharge
9495 energy += x_in_y( type->tool->power_draw % 1000000, 1000000 ) ? 1 : 0;
9496 }
9497 energy -= ammo_consume( energy, pos );
9498
9499 // for power armor pieces, try to use power armor interface first.
9500 if( carrier && is_power_armor() && character_funcs::can_interface_armor( *carrier ) ) {
9501 if( carrier->use_charges_if_avail( itype_bio_armor, energy ) ) {
9502 energy = 0;
9503 }
9504 }
9505
9506 // for items in player possession if insufficient charges within tool try UPS
9507 if( carrier && ( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) ) {
9508 if( carrier->use_charges_if_avail( itype_UPS, energy ) ) {
9509 energy = 0;
9510 }
9511 }
9512
9513 // if insufficient available charges shutdown the tool
9514 if( energy > 0 ) {
9515 if( carrier ) {
9516 if( is_power_armor() ) {
9517 if( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
9518 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You need a UPS or Bionic Power Interface to run the %s!" ),
9519 tname() );
9520 } else {
9521 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You need a Bionic Power Interface to run the %s!" ),
9522 tname() );
9523 }
9524 } else if( has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
9525 carrier->add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You need a UPS to run the %s!" ), tname() );
9526 }
9527 }
9528 if( carrier && type->can_use( "set_transform" ) ) {
9529 const set_transform_iuse *actor = dynamic_cast<const set_transform_iuse *>
9530 ( this->get_use( "set_transform" )->get_actor_ptr() );
9531 if( actor == nullptr ) {
9532 debugmsg( "iuse_actor type descriptor and actual type mismatch." );
9533 return false;
9534 }
9535 std::string transformed_flag = actor->flag;
9536 for( auto &elem : carrier->worn ) {
9537 if( elem.active && elem.has_flag( transformed_flag ) ) {
9538 if( !elem.type->can_use( "set_transformed" ) ) {
9539 debugmsg( "Expected set_transformed function" );
9540 return false;
9541 }
9542 const set_transformed_iuse *actor = dynamic_cast<const set_transformed_iuse *>
9543 ( elem.get_use( "set_transformed" )->get_actor_ptr() );
9544 if( actor == nullptr ) {
9545 debugmsg( "iuse_actor type descriptor and actual type mismatch" );
9546 return false;
9547 }
9548 actor->bypass( *carrier, elem, false, pos );
9549 }
9550 }
9551 }
9552
9553 // invoking the object can convert the item to another type
9554 const bool had_revert_to = type->tool->revert_to.has_value();
9555 type->invoke( carrier != nullptr ? *carrier : you, *this, pos );
9556 if( had_revert_to ) {
9557 deactivate( carrier );
9558 return false;
9559 } else {
9560 return true;
9561 }
9562 }
9563
9564 type->tick( carrier != nullptr ? *carrier : you, *this, pos );
9565 return false;
9566}

Whether this corpse should revive now.

Note that this function includes some randomness, the return value can differ on successive calls.

5961 return false;
5962 }

5964 return false;
5965 }
5966 if( !calendar::once_every( 1_seconds ) ) {
5967 return false;
5968 }
5969 int age_in_hours = to_hours<int>( age() );
5970 age_in_hours -= static_cast<int>( static_cast<float>( burnt ) / ( volume() / 250_ml ) );

5972 age_in_hours /= ( damage_level( 4 ) + 1 );
5973 }

5975 if( age_in_hours > 6 && ( rez_factor <= 0 || one_in( rez_factor ) ) ) {

5977 const bool isReviveSpecial = has_flag( flag_REVIVE_SPECIAL );
5978 if( isReviveSpecial ) {
5979 const int distance = rl_dist( pos, get_player_character().pos() );
5980 if( distance > 3 ) {
5981 return false;
5982 }
5983 if( !one_in( distance + 1 ) ) {
5984 return false;
5985 }
5986 }
5987
5988 return true;
5989 }
5990 return false;

8126 if( ammo->ammo_type() == ammo_plutonium ) {

8128 }

8151 merged = true;
8152 break;

8154 }
8155 if( !merged ) {
8156 put_in( to_reload );
8157 }
8158 } else if( is_watertight_container() ) {

8160 debugmsg( "Tried to reload liquid container with non-liquid." );
8161 return false;
8162 }

8165 }

8170 //~ %1$s: magazine name, %2$s: weapon name
8171 std::string prompt = string_format( pgettext( "magazine", "Eject %1$s from %2$s?" ),
8172 magazine_current()->tname(), tname() );
8173
8174 // eject magazine to player inventory and try to dispose of it from there
8175 item &mag = u.i_add( *magazine_current() );

8177 u.remove_item( mag ); // user canceled so delete the clone
8178 return false;
8179 }
8180 remove_item( *magazine_current() );
8181 }
8182
8183 put_in( *ammo );
8184 loc.remove_item();
8185 return true;
8186
8187 } else {
8188 if( ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER ) ) {
8189 curammo = ammo->contents.front().type;
8190 qty = std::min( qty, ammo->ammo_remaining() );
8191 ammo->ammo_consume( qty, tripoint_zero );
8192 charges += qty;
8193 } else if( ammo->ammo_type() == ammo_plutonium ) {
8194 curammo = ammo->type;
8195 ammo->charges -= qty;
8196
8197 // any excess is wasted rather than overfilling the item
8198 charges += qty * PLUTONIUM_CHARGES;
8199 charges = std::min( charges, ammo_capacity() );
8200 } else {
8201 curammo = ammo->type;
8202 qty = std::min( qty, ammo->charges );
8203 ammo->charges -= qty;
8204 charges += qty;
8205 }
8206 }
8207
8208 if( ammo->charges == 0 && !ammo->has_flag( flag_SPEEDLOADER ) ) {
8209 if( container != nullptr ) {
8210 container->remove_item( container->contents.front() );
8211 u.inv.restack( u ); // emptied containers do not stack with non-empty ones
8212 } else {
8213 loc.remove_item();
8214 }
8215 }
8216 return true;
8217}

◆ simulate_burn()

float item::simulate_burn ( fire_data &  frd) const

Calculate all burning calculations, but don't actually apply them to item.

DO apply them to fire_data argument, though.

Returns
Amount of "burn" that would be applied to the item.

Definition at line 8219 of file item.cpp.

8220{
8221 const std::vector<material_id> &mats = made_of();
8222 float smoke_added = 0.0f;
8223 float time_added = 0.0f;
8224 float burn_added = 0.0f;
8225 const units::volume vol = base_volume();
8226 const int effective_intensity = frd.contained ? 3 : frd.fire_intensity;
8227 for( const material_id &m : mats ) {
8228 const mat_burn_data &bd = m.obj().burn_data( effective_intensity );
8229 if( bd.immune ) {
8230 // Made to protect from fire
8231 return 0.0f;
8232 }
8233
8234 // If fire is contained, burn rate is independent of volume
8235 if( frd.contained || bd.volume_per_turn == 0_ml ) {
8236 time_added += bd.fuel;
8237 smoke_added += bd.smoke;
8238 burn_added += bd.burn;
8239 } else {
8240 double volume_burn_rate = to_liter( bd.volume_per_turn ) / to_liter( vol );
8241 time_added += bd.fuel * volume_burn_rate;
8242 smoke_added += bd.smoke * volume_burn_rate;
8243 burn_added += bd.burn * volume_burn_rate;
8244 }
8245 }
8246
8247 // Liquids that don't burn well smother fire well instead
8248 if( made_of( LIQUID ) && time_added < 200 ) {
8249 time_added -= rng( 400.0 * to_liter( vol ), 1200.0 * to_liter( vol ) );
8250 } else if( mats.size() > 1 ) {
8251 // Average the materials
8252 time_added /= mats.size();
8253 smoke_added /= mats.size();
8254 burn_added /= mats.size();
8255 } else if( mats.empty() ) {
8256 // Non-liquid items with no specified materials will burn at moderate speed
8257 burn_added = 1;
8258 }
8259
8260 if( count_by_charges() ) {
8261 int stack_burnt = rng( type->stack_size / 2, type->stack_size );
8262 time_added *= stack_burnt;
8263 smoke_added *= stack_burnt;
8264 burn_added *= stack_burnt;
8265 }
8266
8267 frd.fuel_produced += time_added;
8268 frd.smoke_produced += smoke_added;
8269 return burn_added;
8270}
units::to_liter
constexpr double to_liter(const volume &v)
Definition: units_volume.h:43
fire_data::fire_intensity
int fire_intensity
Current intensity of the fire.
Definition: fire.h:25
fire_data::fuel_produced
float fuel_produced
Fuel contributed by each burning item this turn is summed here.
Definition: fire.h:29
fire_data::smoke_produced
float smoke_produced
Smoke produced by each burning item this turn is summed here.
Definition: fire.h:27
fire_data::contained
bool contained
The fire is contained and burned for fuel intentionally.
Definition: fire.h:31
mat_burn_data::smoke
float smoke
Smoke produced per tick when this material burns.
Definition: fire.h:54
mat_burn_data::burn
float burn
Volume of material destroyed per tick when this material burns.
Definition: fire.h:56

References base_volume(), mat_burn_data::burn, fire_data::contained, count_by_charges(), fire_data::fire_intensity, mat_burn_data::fuel, fire_data::fuel_produced, mat_burn_data::immune, LIQUID, made_of(), rng(), mat_burn_data::smoke, fire_data::smoke_produced, itype::stack_size, units::to_liter(), type, and mat_burn_data::volume_per_turn.

◆ spoilage_sort_order()

int item::spoilage_sort_order ( ) const

Get time left to rot, ignoring fridge.

Returns time to rot if item is able to, max int - N otherwise, where N is 3 for food, 2 for medication, 1 for other comestibles, 0 otherwise.

903 // check the, the charges must be ignored. In all other cases (tools/guns), the charges are important.

905 return false;

932 // Stack items that fall into the same "bucket" of freshness.
933 // Distant buckets are larger than near ones.
934 std::pair<int, clipped_unit> my_clipped_time_to_rot =
935 clipped_time( get_shelf_life() - rot );
936 std::pair<int, clipped_unit> other_clipped_time_to_rot =
937 clipped_time( rhs.get_shelf_life() - rhs.rot );

939 return false;
940 }

942 // just to be safe that rotten and unrotten food is *never* stacked.
943 return false;
944 }
945 }

947 ( corpse != nullptr && rhs.corpse == nullptr ) ) {
948 return false;
949 }
950 if( corpse != nullptr && rhs.corpse != nullptr && corpse->id != rhs.corpse->id ) {
951 return false;
952 }
953 if( craft_data_ || rhs.craft_data_ ) {
954 // In-progress crafts are always distinct items. Easier to handle for the player,
955 // and there shouldn't be that many items of this type around anyway.
956 return false;
957 }
958 if( check_components || is_comestible() || is_craft() ) {
959 //Only check if at least one item isn't using the default recipe or is comestible

961 if( get_uncraft_components() != rhs.get_uncraft_components() ) {
962 return false;

◆ tname()

bool  with_prefix = true,
unsigned int  truncate = 0 
) const

Return the (translated) item name.

Parameters
quantityused for translation to the proper plural form of the name, e.g. returns "rock" for quantity 1 and "rocks" for quantity > 0.
with_prefixdetermines whether to include more item properties, such as the extent of damage and burning (was created to sort by name without prefix in additional inventory)

4548{
4549 int dirt_level = get_var( "dirt", 0 ) / 2000;
4550 std::string dirt_symbol;
4551 // TODO: MATERIALS put this in json
4552
4553 // these symbols are unicode square characeters of different heights, representing a rough
4554 // estimation of fouling in a gun. This appears instead of "faulty"
4555 // since most guns will have some level of fouling in them, and usually it is not a big deal.
4556 switch( dirt_level ) {
4557 case 0:
4558 dirt_symbol = "";
4559 break;
4560 case 1:
4561 dirt_symbol = "<color_white>\u2581</color>";
4562 break;
4563 case 2:
4564 dirt_symbol = "<color_light_gray>\u2583</color>";
4565 break;
4566 case 3:
4567 dirt_symbol = "<color_light_gray>\u2585</color>";
4568 break;
4569 case 4:
4570 dirt_symbol = "<color_dark_gray>\u2587</color>";
4571 break;
4572 case 5:
4573 dirt_symbol = "<color_brown>\u2588</color>";

4575 default:

4776 //~ This is a string to construct the item name as it is displayed. This format string has been added for maximum flexibility. The strings are: %1$s: Damage text (e.g. "bruised"). %2$s: burn adjectives (e.g. "burnt"). %3$s: tool modifier text (e.g. "atomic"). %4$s: vehicle part text (e.g. "3.8-Liter"). $5$s: main item text (e.g. "apple"). %6s: tags (e.g. "(wet) (poor fit)").

4778 vehtext, maintext, tagtext );
4779
4780 if( truncate != 0 ) {

◆ type_name()

std::string item::type_name ( unsigned int  quantity = 1) const

Name of the item type (not the item), with proper plural.

This is only special when the item itself has a special name ("name" entry in item_tags) or is a named corpse. It's effectively the same as calling nname with the item type id. Use this when the actual item is not meant, for example "The shovel" instead of "Your shovel". Or "The jacket is too small", when it applies to all jackets, not just the one the character tried to wear).

Definition at line 9839 of file item.cpp.

9840{
9841 const auto iter = item_vars.find( "name" );
9842 std::string ret_name;
9843 if( typeId() == itype_blood ) {
9844 if( corpse == nullptr || corpse->id.is_null() ) {
9845 return vpgettext( "item name", "human blood", "human blood", quantity );
9846 } else {
9847 return string_format( vpgettext( "item name", "%s blood",
9848 "%s blood", quantity ),
9849 corpse->nname() );
9850 }
9851 } else if( iter != item_vars.end() ) {
9852 return iter->second;
9853 } else {
9854 ret_name = type->nname( quantity );
9855 }
9856
9857 // Apply conditional names, in order.
9858 for( const conditional_name &cname : type->conditional_names ) {
9859 // Lambda for recursively searching for a item ID among all components.
9860 std::function<bool ( std::list<item> )> component_id_contains =
9861 [&]( std::list<item> components ) {
9862 for( const item &component : components ) {
9863 if( component.typeId().str().find( cname.condition ) != std::string::npos ||
9864 component_id_contains( component.components ) ) {
9865 return true;
9866 }
9867 }
9868 return false;
9869 };
9870 switch( cname.type ) {
9871 case condition_type::FLAG:

9873 ret_name = string_format( cname.name.translated( quantity ), ret_name );
9874 }
9875 break;
9876 case condition_type::COMPONENT_ID:
9877 if( component_id_contains( components ) ) {
9878 ret_name = string_format( cname.name.translated( quantity ), ret_name );
9879 }
9880 break;
9881 case condition_type::num_condition_types:
9882 break;
9883 }
9884 }
9885
9886 // Identify who this corpse belonged to, if applicable.
9887 if( corpse != nullptr && has_flag( flag_CORPSE ) ) {
9888 if( corpse_name.empty() ) {
9889 //~ %1$s: name of corpse with modifiers; %2$s: species name

9892 } else {

9898
9899 return ret_name;

int item::units_remaining ( const Character &  ch,

Parameters

limitstop searching after this many units found

7981{
7982 if( count_by_charges() ) {
7983 return std::min( static_cast<int>( charges ), limit );
7984 }
7985
7986 int res = ammo_remaining();
7987 if( res < limit && is_power_armor() ) {
7988 if( character_funcs::can_interface_armor( ch ) && has_flag( flag_USE_UPS ) ) {
7989 res += std::max( ch.charges_of( itype_UPS, limit - res ), ch.charges_of( itype_bio_armor,
7990 limit - res ) );
7991 } else if( character_funcs::can_interface_armor( ch ) ) {

7998 }

◆ use_amount()

bool item::use_amount ( const itype_id &  it,
int &  quantity,
std::list< item > &  used,
const std::function< bool(const item &)> &  filter = return_true<item> 
)

Consume a specific amount of items of a specific type.

This includes this item, and any of its contents (recursively).

See also
item::use_charges - this is similar for items, not charges.
Parameters
itType of consumable item.
quantityHow much to consumed.
usedOn success all consumed items will be stored here.
filterMust return true for use to occur.

Definition at line 8484 of file item.cpp.

8487 // Remember quantity so that we can unseal self
8488 int old_quantity = quantity;
8489 std::vector<item *> removed_items;
8490 // First, check contents
8491 visit_items(
8492 [&]( item * a ) {
8493 // visit_items checks the item itself first. we want to do its contents first.
8494 if( a == this ) {
8495 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
8496 }
8497 if( a->use_amount_internal( it, quantity, used, filter ) ) {
8498 removed_items.emplace_back( a );
8499 return VisitResponse::SKIP;
8500 }
8501 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
8502 } );
8503
8504 for( item *remove : removed_items ) {
8505 remove_item( *remove );
8506 }
8507
8508 if( quantity != old_quantity ) {
8509 on_contents_changed();
8510 }
8511 return use_amount_internal( it, quantity, used, filter );
8512}

◆ use_charges()

bool item::use_charges ( const itype_id &  what,
int &  qty,
std::list< item > &  used,
const tripoint &  pos,
const std::function< bool(const item &)> &  filter = return_true<item> 
)

Consumes specified charges (or fewer) from this and any contained items.

Parameters
whatspecific type of charge required, e.g. 'battery'
qtymaximum charges to consume. On return set to number of charges not found (or zero)
usedfilled with duplicates of each item that provided consumed charges
posposition at which the charges are being consumed
filterMust return true for use to occur.
Returns
true if this item should be deleted (count-by-charges items with no remaining charges)

Definition at line 8604 of file item.cpp.

8606{
8607 std::vector<item *> del;
8608
8609 visit_items( [&what, &qty, &used, &pos, &del, &filter]( item * e, item * parent ) {
8610 if( qty == 0 ) {
8611 // found sufficient charges
8612 return VisitResponse::ABORT;
8613 }
8614
8615 if( !filter( *e ) ) {
8616 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
8617 }
8618
8619 if( e->is_tool() ) {
8620 if( e->typeId() == what ) {
8621 int n = std::min( e->ammo_remaining(), qty );
8622 qty -= n;
8623
8624 used.push_back( item( *e ).ammo_set( e->ammo_current(), n ) );
8625 e->ammo_consume( n, pos );
8626 }
8627 return VisitResponse::SKIP;
8628
8629 } else if( e->count_by_charges() ) {
8630 if( e->typeId() == what ) {
8631
8632 // if can supply excess charges split required off leaving remainder in-situ
8633 item obj = e->split( qty );
8634 if( parent ) {
8635 parent->on_contents_changed();
8636 }
8637 if( !obj.is_null() ) {
8638 used.push_back( obj );
8639 qty = 0;
8640 return VisitResponse::ABORT;
8641 }
8642
8643 qty -= e->charges;
8644 used.push_back( *e );
8645 del.push_back( e );
8646 }
8647 // items counted by charges are not themselves expected to be containers
8648 return VisitResponse::SKIP;
8649 }
8650
8651 // recurse through any nested containers
8652 return VisitResponse::NEXT;
8653 } );
8654
8655 bool destroy = false;
8656 for( item *e : del ) {
8657 if( e == this ) {
8658 destroy = true; // cannot remove ourselves...
8659 } else {
8660 remove_item( *e );
8661 }
8662 }
8663
8664 return destroy;
8665}

References ABORT, count_by_charges(), is_tool(), NEXT, SKIP, and visitable< item >::visit_items().

◆ volume()

units::volume item::volume ( bool  integral = false) const

Total volume of an item accounting for all contained/integrated items NOTE: Result is rounded up to next nearest milliliter when working with stackable (count_by_charges) items that have fractional volume per charge.

If trying to determine how many of an item can fit in a given space, charges_per_volume should be used instead.

Parameters
integralif true return effective volume if this item was integrated into another

5100 return 0_ml;
5101 }

5110 ret += it.volume();
5111 }

5115 const int local_volume = get_var( "volume", -1 );
5116 units::volume ret;
5117 if( local_volume >= 0 ) {
5118 ret = local_volume * units::legacy_volume_factor;

5121 } else {

5134 ret += 1_ml;
5135 }

◆ rot

time_duration item::rot = 0_turns
private

Accumulated rot, expressed as time the item has been in standard temperature.

It is compared to shelf life (islot_comestible::spoils) to decide if the item is rotten.

Definition at line 2220 of file item.h.
